Job Title: Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains System Manager
Job Description:
Diligent Delivery Systems is hiring a full-time Microsoft Dynamics Great Plains and Accounting Manager. The individual will be tasked with managing our system, supporting upgrades, identifying process improvements and leading system integration efforts.

There will be heavy data analysis using Excel and Access and assisting the Information Technology Department with administering an in-house developed SQL-based ERP system and other third-party systems, which all interface with the Accounting system (Dynamics Great Plains).

This function includes ensuring that all operational transactions are captured accurately and interfaced timely with accounting systems, while maintaining data integrity. This function provides support to the Accounting Department under the direction of the CIO for primary data flow and special analysis and data management projects. The Manager also interfaces with the Accounting Department and servers as a liaison between Accounting and IT.

This position is in-office, M-F and no remote or hybrid work schedule is considered.

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY-NO RELOCATION PACKAGE AVAILABLE.

Key points and requirements to the position are:

· Administer Microsoft Dynamics GP system to ensure a secure and stable application.

· Maintain interfaces between custom ERP applications and GP. Ensure systems correctly integrate and communicate.

· Support deployment of new ERP applications and ensure GP is prepared on the backend.

· Identify opportunities to leverage GP capabilities in support of business goals and objectives.

· Support development, administration and project work that relates to GP.

· Improve and expand GP's reporting capabilities using Smartlist, Excel Reports, SSRS, Crystal Reports, and ad-hoc SQL queries.

· Responsible for implementing, upgrading and customizing GP with systems in place and new deployments.

· Understand the processes of various corporate and operational departments within the company in order to translate those needs into IT solutions

· Support the corporate and operations users when issues arise with their systems and work with the users to understand the issues

· Team environment; good interpersonal skills required, working alongside colleagues as well as independently

· Fast-paced environment; constant deadlines and sometimes switching tasks midstream

· Independent, positive thinking and adapting to changing circumstances

REQUIREMENTS:

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics (Great Plains) is required
Bachelor's degree in technology, Accounting or related discipline
Familiarity with accounting processes and flow of data on the General Ledger and financial statements
Must be well-organized, have a strong attention to detail, and have the ability to work on multiple projects with changing priorities
Familiarity with Business Analysis skills such as process flow documenting
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (and to a lesser extent Microsoft Access)·
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to communicate to technical and non-technical people
Ability to work full-time regular office hours with extended hours required during crunch time on projects
Transportation and/or Freight experience a plus

About Us

Diligent Delivery Systems is an established nationwide logistics company servicing thousands of clients across many industries. We utilize thousands of vendors to conduct physical deliveries on behalf of our clients with a focus on domestic final-mile ground delivery, warehousing and fulfillment across the U.S., providing a critical point-of-sale delivery to our clients.

Primary Role and Responsibilities

Business Strategic

The vCIO should discover what the client’s business does to earn revenue, how it operates internally to achieve that revenue and what their business goals/plans are near and long term.

Technology Strategic

The vCIO should discover what the client's applications are and what the business purpose is for the applications that they are using, i.e. how does this application/system help them accomplish their business goals. In addition, to help a client take advantage of the technology they have to meet their business objectives.

Business and Technology Strategic Communication

The vCIO must be able to communicate to the CITOC Professional services team and the MSP Engineering team what he/she has discovered in the Business and Technology strategic analysis.

Standards Alignment, Roadmap and Budget

The vCIO, in conjunction with the Technical Alignment Engineer, is to submit to the Professional services team any discrepancies that have been found between the client’s environment and the CITOC's I.T. Standards and Best Practices. Once the Professional services team has created scopes of work and proposals for the client, the vCIO will submit and explain to the client any quotes generated from that process. In addition, from the Technical Alignment engineer and the Professional team’s work the vCIO is to define a technical roadmap and an I.T. budget for the client. The vCIO needs to be able to explain, in layman’s terms, to the client what the standards and best practices are and why the business needs them. Lastly the vCIO needs to be able to explain in layman’s terms each quote and what business objective that they achieve.

Liaison

The vCIO manages the “business” relationship with the client and helps them achieve their business goals. He is the liaison between the Professional and MSP teams and the client. Tactical technical issues that a client communicates to the vCIO must be handed off to the Technical Alignment engineer or Service Management.

Required Skills

Complete understanding of CITOC’s Standards and Best Practices along with the ability to explain to the client in layman’s terms what they are and why they are necessary.

Complete understanding of CITOC’s recommended I.T. Policies and the ability to explain to the client in layman’s terms what they are and why they are necessary.

The ability to explain in laymen’s terms a proposed solution, how it works and how it benefits the client’s business.

The ability to explain to CITOC engineers, the client's Line Of Business applications, what data they create and what it consists of.

Communication - Ability to communicate verbally and in writing clearly and concisely; edits work for spelling and grammar; varies style to meet needs; presents numerical data effectively.

Business Ethics - Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works with integrity and is ethical; upholds organizational values.

Analytical Skills – Business analysis of a client’s environment.

The ability to listen without pre-judgement; the ability to hear what a client or fellow employee is saying.

vCIO Tasks

Business Analysis – The Client’s business, operations and use of technology.

Standards alignment

Lifecycle budgeting

Technology Business Review (QBR)

Review of reactive tickets

Creation of a client meeting agenda

Proposal requests from the Professional services team

Creation of a Technical Roadmap from the Professional services and Technical Alignment engineer input

Initial creation of User Forms

Perform the Kickoff Meetings

Creates I.T. policy templates for client use

Owns the business relationship

SALARY: Commensurate with Experience

Work Remotely

No

Job Title: Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst
Job Description:
Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst

Pemex Deer Parkis a highly complex refinery located 18 miles east of Houston in Deer Park, TX. It is part of the Pemex group, a fully integrated oil company in the Americas, working across the entire value chain: exploration, production, industrial processing/refining, logistics, and marketing. The refinery’s rated capacity is 340,000 barrels per day and has the feed flexibility to process multiple grades of crudes to produce the high-quality transportation fuels the world needs. The Pemex site is co-located with other 3rd party chemical facilities, allowing for further integration and optimization of the refinery and its products. Pemex Deer Park provides a diverse and inclusive work environment that employs approximately 1000 employees with another 1000 contractors on site. We set high standards of performance and ethical behaviors and offer challenging and fulfilling job opportunities in a number of fields. We take great pride in our ability to ensure the health and safety of our workers and the environment while being a good neighbor and having a positive impact on the local community where we work.

Best-in-Class Benefits and Perks:

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation depending on experience and an extensive benefits package including:

Comprehensive health coverage: Medical, dental, and vision insurance provided.
Robust retirement planning: 401(k) plan available with employer matching.
Financial security: Life and disability insurance for added protection.
Flexible financial options: Health savings and flexible spending accounts are offered.
Well-being and work-life balance: Paid time off and 9/80 Flexible Working Schedule, including limited ability to work remotely.

Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.

We seek a Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst who will support the IT Enterprise Digital Solutions Manager to drive alignment between IT and the business. Your role will include working with a variety of teams leading activities and projects related to RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics. Your objective is to find daily continuous improvement opportunities, including understanding their business processes, requirements, and use of each application. As the Business Systems Analyst, you will assist in project planning, coordination with vendors, and follow-up on support efforts our remote support teams are giving. From a site perspective, you will link the business and our different IT teams, translating business needs into technical solutions. You will also establish IT Application best practices at the site. We expect you to seek to understand the Refinery business and oil and Gas practices and feel comfortable working in a Plant-type environment. Creativity and customer-centric attitudes are fundamental in this role.

To be successful, you must have:

Understanding of common applications used at a Refinery
Understanding of applications and processes where Value can be created
Strong technical abilities in application design, configuration, implementation, and support
Should have working knowledge of RBI (Risk Based Inspections), RCM (Reliability Centred Maintenance), OTM (Operator Technical Monitoring), LTPTM (Long Term Proactive Technical Monitoring), RCA (Root Cause Analysis), and Predictive Analytics
Understanding of standard business processes in a Refinery or the Oil & Gas industry
Understanding of key ‘pain points’ in typical IT Applications environment
Ease / Proficiency in understanding complex business processes and translating them into technical solutions.
Experience developing “how to use” type documents
Experience creating an applications inventory and portfolio
Team leadership skills: able to lead, communicate, and interact with offsite Support teams
Experience having worked in similar roles or environments
Comfortable working at a Refinery or have worked in similar type plants.
Strong communication skills (written and verbal) among IT, digital, and business stakeholders
Comfortable in a multi-tasking type environment

Preferred Experience in the following software:

Operator Technical Monitoring (Intellatrac / Aveva – Mobile Operator)

Your responsibilities as the Sr. IT Enterprise APM (Asset Performance Management) Business Analyst will include:

Stakeholder Management

Interacts with business stakeholders, their engagements/projects, understanding needs and / or requirements
Represents Health, Safety, Security, and Environmental team needs to be incorporated into the overall Enterprise Architecture
Handles and manages a portfolio of Applications within the mentioned Teams
Actively participate in Business and IT team discussions, bringing in best practices to and from the site

Value Generation & Protection

Maintain & support portfolio of Applications
Define when to purchase (OTS), use current application, or internal development.
Work with businesses to define and document business processes
Lead any new application projects, deployments, and enhancement
Contribute to the creation of knowledge-based articles used for Support
Lead the offsite Applications Support teams
Vendor management and engagement
Contract management, license management
Understand, plan, and deploy application upgrades/patches
Contribute to budget management for Applications – control spend
Definition/control of Application Support Desk KPIs
Define / Modify end-user service model – escalations, levels of service, feedback from end users
Contribute to IT communications – prepare and communicate for specific applications working with IT Operations lead
IT Policies and procedures – define, deploy, and enforce the correct use of applications.
Interact with all IT Teams – coordinating daily activities and projects

Join our Commodities and Global Market’s Business Credit Team in Houston as a Junior Business Credit Analyst.

In this role, you will cover a portfolio of North American trading counterparties and actively communicate with the various trading desks to fully understand the risk nature of the transactions requiring analysis and approval. You will research, gather information and prepare credit review memos that are commensurate to the potential trade exposure and the credit quality of Macquarie’s counterparties. Traded products included will be North American physical and financial power, emissions, oil and natural gas.

Being a collaborative team member who builds open dialogue-based relationships will help you succeed in meeting with existing and potential clients as part of the due diligence process to gain a better understand of the client’s financial position and operations. You will utilize your persuasive communication skills (both written and verbal), combined with confidence when being challenged as you will liaise with the traders/marketers and respond to trading requests daily. Your ability to maintain accurate attention to detail, handle pressure and competing priorities in a deadline driven environment is critical to your success in this role.

Additional Responsibilities include:

Trade documentation initialization, review and negotiation of credit risk and other risk clauses.
Financial analysis and credit underwriting, including an understanding of complex corporate structures.
Credit exposure calculation and credit limit management, including ongoing communication with the corporate credit group and senior business management to obtain timely trade approvals.
Real time, on-going and self-initiated monitoring of counterparty and related industry developments including the annual review of existing credit limits.
Proactively engage with business units and colleagues to understand underlying needs and opportunities and identify innovative solutions in a timely manner.

This role requires a bachelor’s degree and qualifications in Finance, Economics, Engineering, or other quantitative disciplines. Experience in broader credit risk analysis and possessing a high degree of ownership, delivery and timeliness are highly desired. North American energy trading market knowledge, although not required, would be beneficial to have.

The variety of work offers unmatched learning and development opportunities working with an established and experienced Credit team.

If you have 2-3 years of experience with credit risk in financial markets, possess strong numerical and analytical skills, and see yourself as having a high degree of initiative, achievement drive, and an inquisitive nature, apply today.

About Commodities and Global Markets

Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated, end-to-end offering across global markets including equities, fixed income, foreign exchange and commodities.

Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and an inclusive workplace enables us to embrace that diversity to deliver more innovative and sustainable solutions for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. At Macquarie, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If you're inspired to deliver on our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’, we want you on our team. If you need adjustments made to the recruitment process, please reach out to your recruiter.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, marital status, gender identity or any other impermissible criterion or circumstance. Macquarie also takes affirmative action in support of its policy to hire and advance in employment of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

We equip our people with the support to work in a range of flexible ways. Talk to us about what working arrangements would help you thrive.

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.

Job Title: Lead Analyst – SAP PRA Business Systems - Houston, TX - 2310002255
Job Description:
Are you interested in joining our team? Chat with our digital assistant to learn more about our company and apply right from your mobile device!

Text ETP to 25000 to get started or apply through this web posting if you prefer.

Energy Transfer, a Fortune 50 organization, recognized by Forbes as one of America's best large employers, is dedicated to responsibly and safely delivering America’s energy. We are driven to inspire our employees to create superior value for our customers, our investors, a sustainable futureand giving backto the community where we have long-standing commitments to causes including MD Anderson Children’s Cancer Hospital, The Salvation Army, American Heart Association, Ronald McDonald House and many more. Come join our award winning 10,000 strong organization as we fuel the world and each other!

This position comes with world class compensation, benefits, 401(k) match, profit sharing, and PTO.

Summary:

Energy Transfer, is currently seeking an SAP PRA specialist to support their PRA system. The PRA system is heavily customized and will require skills to reverse engineer processes and trouble shoot custom and standard SAP PRA issues. The project went live 6 months ago and requires production support. This position is part of the Accounting and Finance organization and supports the Crude Oil Acquisition and Marketing segment of the Organization. The position will involve working closely with Division Order, Regulatory, Deal Capture, and IT.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Serve as SAP PRA system specialist for the business
Designated by a Business Application Owner to be the business liaison for a specific application function
Should be able to analyze tickets that come in, understand if the solution needed is a code fix, process change or an issue with the master/transaction data.
Understand the customizations in the system by reading documents, debugging and recreating data in the test system
Fix issues arising in the PRA interfaces
Able to resolve issues in Valuation, Payments and other PRA modules in a timely manner
Escalated support of Users, Super Users, and SME's
Work with the Functional Analysts, Technical Analysts, and other technical resources as necessary to resolve issues
Should be able to replicate issues in the test system and reverse engineer processes with minimal supervision
Strong debugging skills will be very helpful
Business requirements definition and prioritization
User acceptance testing coordination (or execution)
Assessment of business process improvement recommendations and prioritization
Proactive business process and application improvement recommendations
Work alongside business as liaison to IT for PRA trouble shooting
Gain knowledge of all marketing contracts, division order processes, and regulatory requirements as they relate to SAP PRA
Prepare and analyze metrics as it relates to the various back office functional teams
Assist management in the creation of system reports
Able to adapt to rapidly changing priorities

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:

Minimum of 5 years of working in SAP with strong knowledge in SAP PRA
Knowledge of check write process in PRA
Experience troubleshooting issues arising in valuation
Knowledge of Contractual Allocations and related processes
Needs to understand the Ownership process, knowledge of cross reference setup and how each PRA module relates to other modules
Able to understand customizations in the system and become comfortable working with them quickly
Strong Analytic skills to understand the root cause of issues
Ability to debug programs to identify the issue will be very helpful as the system is very customized will be very helpful
Experienced in a customized SAP system which requires a lot of troubleshooting
Able to recreate issues in the test system
Analytic and data analysis skills required, especially MS Excel
Strong communication skills
Highly detailed oriented
Able to prioritize and multi-task

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2 - 5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5 - 8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

Job Title: Epic Business Analyst III - Grand Central
Job Description:
Job Description


Harris Health System is the public healthcare safety-net provider established in 1966 to serve the residents of Harris County, Texas. As an essential healthcare system, Harris Health champions better health for the entire community, with a focus on low-income uninsured and underinsured patients, through acute and primary care, wellness, disease management and population health services. Ben Taub Hospital (Level 1 Trauma Center) and Lyndon B. Johnson Hospital (Level 3 Trauma Center) anchor Harris Health’s robust network of 39 clinics, health centers, specialty locations and virtual (telemedicine) technology. Harris Health is among an elite list of health systems in the U.S. achieving Magnet® nursing excellence designation for its hospitals, the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance designation for its patient-centered clinics and health centers and its strong partnership with nationally recognized physician faculty, residents and researchers from Baylor College of Medicine; McGovern Medical School at The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth); The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center; and the Tilman J. Fertitta Family College of Medicine at the University of Houston.

Skills / Requirements

The Epic Business Analyst III ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Systems Department. This role supports all application deployed within the Harris County Hospital District system.

Minimum Qualifications
Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Computer Science Bachelor Degree or Related Experience

Work Experience: 5+ Years within I.S. Three (3) Years Hospital Health Care Organizations Business Analysis

Management Experience: Resource Oversight experience

Special Requirements
Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact), Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking) Writing/Composing (Correspondence/Reports)

Other Skills: Analytical, Design, Research, Statistical

MAJOR DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Works with clients to develop business requirements; conducts business analysis including analysis of the competitive situation, understanding business practices and approaches and recommending business process changes. Serves as conduit between division and IT to integrate systems and business processes, drive their work into systems initiatives and lead system selection processes.
Plans and executes unit, integration and acceptance testing; and creates specifications for systems to meet business requirements. Designs details of automated systems.
Conducts significant systems testing; supports data conversions; supports local system rollouts; exercises any required project management and execute all work in alignment with HISD’s systems plans.
Understands, proposes, educates and helps implement new business processes through business operations and new systems. Works to continually understand business requirements, document them in standard formats, obtain business user approval and work them seamlessly into the bigger picture.
Helps users develop processes, procedures, and training.
May provide consultation to users in the area of automated systems. May lead cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.

EDUCATION

Bachelor’s Degree; Master’s Degree preferred or some graduate coursework

In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree, additional equivalent and directly-related education and experience, as determined by Human Resources and the hiring manager, may fulfill the education requirement. Equivalent experience is four or more years in a related field in an exempt-level position, in addition to the minimum experience requirement of 7 years.

WORK EXPERIENCE

7+ years
IT professional coming from other disciplines with 7+ years of directly related IT experience.

1. Visit www.houstonisd.org/careers

2. Search "Sr Business Systems Analyst" in the search bar or Job Id#2098

3. Click "apply now"

*PLEASE NOTE* our application system requires a two-step completion process. Please check your email, including your spam folder, for an email requesting you to confirm personal information. Thank you.

Summary/Objective

The Analyst position is responsible for collecting and synthesizing information, conducting analysis, and presenting insights to support strategic business decisions. This position will work across Astros and affiliate business operations teams to collaborate on solutions and implement new initiatives. The Analyst will be a key contributor to the department mission of increasing long-term revenue, improving the fan experience, and creating operational efficiency.




Essential Functions & Responsibilities

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Perform research and build data sets from available internal and external sources
Extract meaningful observations and insights from research and data sets to support fact-based decision-making
Build predictive models to support ticket forecasting, ticket pricing, marketing and advertising allocation, and operational planning
Write, build, and analyze fan-focused research surveys
Support data capture through internal systems and empower business owners to leverage the information available to them
Identify opportunities to share best practices across our business and support process changes
Present data insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Provide additional support for on-going Business Strategy & Analytics projects
Performs other related duties as assigned



Education and/or Experience & Skills

Required

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Computer Science, Statistics, or other data-related discipline
1+ years of related experience business, consulting, finance, sports and entertainment, or related fields
Strong understanding of statistics e.g., predictive modeling, hypothesis testing, and experimental design
Experience working in SQL and R or other statistical programming language
Experience working with data visualization (e.g., Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI)
Strong presentation skills
Strong attention to detail and promptness
Ability to learn quickly and be resourceful
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines

Preferred

Experience leading projects and interacting with clients and/or other business units
Experience with relational databases
Experience designing and writing primary research surveys
Passion for baseball



Work Environment

This job operates in a clerical, office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.




Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close and focused vision.




Position Type and Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Ability to work a flexible schedule, including; extended hours, evenings, weekends and holidays.




Travel

Rare travel may be expected for this position.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

At Enbridge, our goal is to be the first-choice energy delivery company in North America and beyond—for customers, communities, investors, regulators and policymakers, and employees.

To meet that goal, Enbridge is partnering with Raise—a leading recruitment firm that specializes in IT, Technical, and Engineering staffing.

Together, Raise and Enbridge are building teams that are rising to meet the growing energy needs of North America. If you’re looking for a challenging role that will make the most of your skills while allowing you to make an impact, this is it.

Enbridge is hiring a Business Analyst right now—when you apply, Raise will review your application within 48 hours and contact qualified applicants for interviews.


Description

The role is responsible for meeting the Program Development Office’s project objectives, completing deliverables, and developing business processes. The IM Business Analyst serves as a liaison to functional Business Leads to translate and prioritize business requirements for GTM Operations business process optimization projects throughout the project lifecycle. The skillset should be interchangeable between different types of GTMO projects, while also assisting the IM supervisor with ad-hoc and special project work.

The IM Business Analyst reports directly to the IM Supervisor and supports the IM Process Specialist. From a project perspective, the IM Business Analyst has a dotted line report to the IM Project Managers in which they are assigned to. The IM Business Analyst is accountable for working with all GTM program owners (inclusive of Business Sponsors and Business Leads), stakeholders, and enterprise services to help identify project interdependencies.


Key Responsibilities

Indirect report to the Project Manager to assist with project scope definition and provide business analysis support throughout the project lifecycle.
May assist the Project Manager with project management tasks as needed, scheduling, documentation, issues, change requests, status, etc.
Strong writing skills to prepare business cases, current state (as-is) and future state (to be) analysis, process flow mapping, RACI and RAPID model, business process optimization recommendations, workshop facilitations, and training content.
Assists the business in identifying proper controls, recommendations for automation, and understands integration with other interdependent programs.
Responsible for preparing business requirements (business rules, business/functional/technical) specifications and managing requests for changes to the specifications.
Maintains functional peer relationships and detailed working knowledge of the assigned areas systems, organization, and business processes.
Can act as a cross functional Business Analyst to support multiple areas of the business such as asset management, pipeline integrity, facility integrity, work management, compliance, etc.


Criteria & Qualifications

Business Analyst certification, related degree and/or a minimum of 10 years related experience within the oil and gas industry
Must have oil and gas experience with Field Operations project support
Understanding of project lifecycle stage gating controls and importance of document and records management
Ability to support, adapt to change quickly, and move across various types of projects when needed
Excellent writing skills, problem solving skills, interpersonal skills, oral communication skills, and time management
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office products, especially Visio, Teams, and MS Project
Ability to influence and negotiate with clients and 3rd party vendors
Proficient at operating within a North Americanly distributed team


Please note: Successful applicants will be employees of Raise, working at Enbridge facilities with both Enbridge and contract employees.

Job Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst (NOT A REMOTE OPPORTUNITY - this role is located in our offices in Houston, Texas)
Job Description:
Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Company: Spark Energy




Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst




Location: Houston, Texas (NOT a remote opportunity)




Department: Analytics & Strategic Projects




Reports to: Manager, Business Intelligence




FLSA Status: Exempt




JOB SUMMARY

The primary purpose of the Business Intelligence Data Analyst role is to assist management in making informed business decisions based on the output of the data warehouse by mining for important facts and statistics within the data that help render a true picture of the organization’s performance. Key to this role is the ability to extract and manipulate complex data from multiple sources and systems and synthesize the results into clear dashboards and presentations to monitor the performance of our business. The ideal candidate will have a background doing quantitative and qualitative analysis on transactional and financial data within an Energy company; be comfortable with large and complex data sets and be adept at preparing intelligent dashboards, metrics and reports to drive exceptional business insights.




SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Implementation and ownership of an internal data governance program
High degree of initiative and enthusiasm about data and the ability to derive value from data
Collect past and present data to establish trends within the organizational data
Analyze existing data to develop projections of the outcomes of implementing certain business strategies based on historical data
Analyze existing data with an eye for identifying and resolving anomalies or inconsistencies within the data
Implementation of a data quality standard and plan for the data warehouse
Ability to collaborate effectively with the BI team and end users to define and mine the right data sources efficiently and accurately
Proficient SQL skills and mastery of Excel
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects while still delivering timely and accurate results
Strong verbal and written communications skills that enable you to explain complex insights with clarity and precision
Work with third party vendors to reconcile data integration points on a regular basis
Create high-impact and compelling visuals to present metrics and findings to management and colleagues
Experience in managing large complicated data sets and integrating disparate sources of data into a databases or data warehouse for ease of reporting and analysis
Strong communication & presentation skills (verbal and written) with executive-level reporting experience



MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS




3+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst preferably in a company with large, complex data sources
Experience with database tools and SQL Server 2008/2012 is required
Experience with Tableau or a comparable analytics platform is preferred
Experience with large, raw data sets is required
Retail energy industry experience preferred
Exhibit a professional and positive attitude
Adapt readily to change
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Self-motivated, results oriented individual
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, problem solving, written, and verbal communication skills
Perform well in a fast-paced, deadline and detail-oriented work environment
Successfully execute many complex tasks simultaneously
Knowledge and ability to facilitate meetings, conduct effective briefings and presentations and to develop consensus both internal and externally

ABILITIES REQUIRED




Ability to meet highest attendance requirements.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
Ability to use personal computer, calculator, etc.
Could involve some lifting up to 20 pounds.
Ability to sit for extended periods of time without much movement.
Ability to work in time-sensitive environment with non-flexible deadlines.

JOB SUMMARY

The primary responsibilities of the Process Automation entry level Business Analyst to support the strategy and design of the process automation business solution. Identify potential processes that are good for automation. Assist with the creation of process design documents, testing, troubleshooting and reporting. This role will interface directly with the business and act as liaison between process owners, the technical automation team, and the center of excellence (COE).

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Identify and prioritize key areas of the business where robotic solutions and automations can drive significant business benefit
Helps identify automation candidates and develop associated business cases for opportunities for improvement in existing processes
Collaborate with process owners to understand the end-to-end process
Assist with the creation of process design documents, testing, troubleshooting and reporting
Define complexity of the process in terms of Robotic Process Automation to alter or reengineer the process to automate or improve automation potential
Analyze and observe processes to understand the steps and applications used to complete business transactions
Develop Process Design Documents (PDDs) to inform development of automations by technical teams
Partner with process owners and the center of excellence (COE) throughout the course of process identification, planning, and implementation of automations, and serve as a liaison with the technical team and business team/process owner to develop engagement deliverables, such as PDD, test plan, test cases, and test automations
Serve as integrators between business needs and technology solutions, helping to create technology-enabled solutions to meet business needs
Collaborate with leaders to understand and bring to bear innovative digital technologies (RPA, AI, etc.) to transform business processes.
Identify automation industry best practices and recommend opportunities to improve work procedures

Qualifications


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience
Ability to learn information quickly and apply risk/control considerations which impact downstream decisions.
Critical thinking skills with strong attention to detail and follow up.
High degree of professionalism and personal integrity
Excellent interpersonal, communications, presentation skills and organizational skills
Effective project management skills (task identification, prioritization, and documentation)



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Should have a good blend of Technology and Process knowledge

Excellence – Level Two

Safety – Level Two

IT Environment - Level One

IT Governance - Level Two
Data Collection and Analysis - Level Two
Project Management - Level Two

Office environment

OVERVIEW
The Houston Public Works Department (HPW) is the largest and most diverse public works organization in the country. Accredited by the American Public Works Association, our over 4,000 dedicated public servants work together to create a strong foundation for Houston to thrive.

Within the HPW Department, the Houston Permitting Center Service Line (HPC) administers & enforces over 400 permit types for the City of Houston and its jurisdictions, annually reviews over 70 thousand commercial & residential plans. All members of the Houston Permitting Center team are service providers, and we work with the shared values of respect, ownership, communication, integrity, and teamwork.

DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Staff Analyst - Business Analyst

Functions in an analyst role reporting to the Senior Staff Analyst will provide analytical, administrative and/or management systems services.

The position will serve as a business process analyst representing the permitting organization in support of HouPermits, the permitting system that is currently in development. This business analyst will support system implementation, and work in a support role translating business needs into system requirements.

Responsibilities aligned with our Five to Thrive:

Respect – we listen and care

Ownership – we find solutions instead of excuses
Assists with tracking business requirements against the system development to ensure the requirements are considered and any gaps in system functionality are understood and accommodated.
Assists with testing and provides feedback, including recommendations for improvement to either system configuration or business processes.
Participates in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements.
Investigates and makes recommendations for addressing issues of medium to high complexity and/or sensitivity.
Completes special projects as assigned, working on a wide variety of financial, administrative, professional, management and community issues and problems of medium to high complexity.
Makes recommendations for process improvements.
Communication – we are reliable and clear
Assists in translating business requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, and user acceptance testing.

Job Title: J D Edwards Financial Business Analyst

Demonstration a continuous improvement and scalability mindset when working on billing enhancement projects.

Build an understanding of the business at a level of detail that enables them to identify and address critical issues.
Assist in product/billing QA testing when new offers are designed.

2 years' experience in information systemsSince 1954, Texas Children's has been leading the charge in patient care, education and research to accelerate health care for children and women around the world. When you love what you do, it truly shows in the smiles of our patient families, employees and our numerous accolades such as being consistently ranked as the best children's hospital in Texas, and among the top in the nation by U.S.News & World Report as well as recognition from Houston Business Journal as one of this city's Best Places to Work for ten consecutive years.

Texas Children's comprehensive health care network includes our primary hospital in the Texas Medical Center with expertise in over 40 pediatric subspecialties; the Jan and Dan Duncan Neurological Research Institute (NRI); the Feigin Center for pediatric research; Texas Children's Pavilion for Women, a comprehensive obstetrics/gynecology facility focusing on high-risk births; Texas Children's Hospital West Campus, a community hospital in suburban West Houston; and Texas Children's Hospital The Woodlands, the first hospital devoted to children's care for communities north of Houston. We have also created the nation's first HMO for children, established the largest pediatric primary care network in the country and a global health program that is channeling care to children and women all over the world. Position Summary:

Designs, develops and implements new or enhanced business processes in support of new or enhanced information systems and technology. Provides the business expertise in support of business process changes for information systems projects. Identifies opportunities for business process improvement and initiates projects to make improvements with or without deploying information technology.


Position Key Accountabilities:

1. Analyzes current business processes, suggest improvements and participates in design of new business processes and systems.
2. Conducts business systems analysis and design, data modeling, process flow modeling, and process reengineering. Analyzes business processes and reviews existing information systems. Interviews users. Analyzes process flows, identifies opportunities for improvement. Maps existing business processes. Documents existing business processes and business rules.
3. Prepares business cases including cost/benefit analysis for proposed processes.
4. Participates in the design of new systems that support business processes. Designs and implements new or improved business processes. Reviews new systems designs and functions. Compares differences between existing systems and new systems. Designs system modifications. Designs interfaces to other systems. Identifies data, interfaces and tests requirements. Designs and executes systems tests and acceptance test scripts and procedures. Develops and leads communications as part of system implementation efforts. Helps to ensure referential integrity of the data model.
5. Develops reports and documents for existing business processes and business rules. Identifies reporting requirements.
6. Develops organizational changes and implementation plans. Analyzes training and organizational changes. Designs training materials. Trains users in new procedures and systems.
7. Communicates with clients and co-workers via oral and written communications including presentations.
8. Adheres to UT-H IT policies and procedures and industry accepted practice.
9. Works as a member of a multi-disciplinary team. Communicates project status and objectives. Communicates with project team and constituencies.
10. Conducts post implementation review and document goal attainment. Provides post implementation support.
11. Performs other duties as assigned.

Certification/Skills:

Prefer CPA and/or other business related certifications.

Minimum Education:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, a business related field or related experience in lieu of education.

Minimum Experience:

Three (3) years of experience. May substitute required experience with equivalent years of education beyond the minimum education requirement.

Physical Requirements:

Exerts up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to 10 pounds frequently and/or a negligible amount constantly to move objects.

Security Sensitive:

This job class may contain positions that are security sensitive and thereby subject to the provisions of Texas Education Code § 51.215

Residency Requirement:

Employees must permanently reside and work in the State of Texas.

Position Summary



As a Junior IT Business Analyst, your primary purpose is to collaborate with and support seasoned business analysts in translating business needs into effective technology solutions. You will play a vital role in contributing to the documentation of requirements, participating in product design discovery, and assisting in the development of reliable and cost-effective solutions. This role is designed to provide you with a learning environment where you can grow alongside experienced professionals, gaining valuable insights into the intersection of technology and business analysis. This position will give you the opportunity to grow to become an active thought partner and solution visionary who shapes the technology demand and direction in the business organization.


LOCATION


Role provides the opportunity to work in hybrid environment, working both virtually and in office when required.
Duties & Responsibilities


Works with IT and the business to identify opportunities for systematic or process improvements to reduce process inefficiencies and improve service levels.
Supporting Requirements Gathering:
o Collaborate with and assist senior business analysts in gathering and documenting business needs and objectives.
o Participate in interviews, surveys, and workshops to collect information from end-users and subject matter experts.

Documentation Assistance:
o Work with senior analysts to translate business requirements into clear and concise documentation.
o Contribute to the creation of user stories, use cases, and process flows to effectively communicate requirements.

Collaborative Product Design:
o Support senior analysts in product design discovery sessions with Product Owners and users.
o Assist in translating business requirements into valuable offerings that align with project goals.

Solution Development Support:
o Work alongside the team to leverage existing, new, or emerging technologies for developing cost-effective solutions.
o Contribute to the design process, ensuring solutions meet business requirements and address challenges effectively.

Team Collaboration:
o Collaborate closely with existing business analysts, developers, testers, and project managers to ensure the successful delivery of solutions.
o Engage in effective communication with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Learning and Development:
o Actively seek opportunities to learn from experienced professionals.
o Demonstrate eagerness to enhance skills and understanding of business processes and technology concepts.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Management Information Systems (MIS) or equivalent combination of education and experience.
0-2 years of experience with IT business support.

Some basic knowledge of database design and development.


DESIRED


Masters in computer science, Management Information Systems (MIS).
Degree or diploma in Business Management.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or PMI-BA certification.
Experience in wring SQL queries is a plus.
IT internship experience.

Professional commitment to high quality, and a passion for learning new skills.
Detail-oriented individual with the ability to rapidly learn new concepts and methodologies.
Strong problem-solving skills, including providing simple solutions to complex situations.

ENGIE is committed to reshaping the energy future through the global implementation of a lower carbon energy economy in order to preserve the world’s natural resources. We are looking for talented and driven people who are committed to making the vision a reality.




The Business Operations Analyst I will be engaged in a broad range of business operation activities in support of project development and construction activities throughout ENGIE North America’s (ENA) portfolio of utility-scale wind and solar assets.




This individual will work on discrete tasks, with minimal need for oversight, in support of managers, directors and vice presidents within ENA’s Grid Scale Renewables’ Project Development, Project Delivery and Commercial Strategy teams. These work efforts will focus on establishing, maintaining, and assisting with various business operations improvement initiatives. The successful candidate is responsible for assisting with the development of a well-integrated process methodology across the full life cycle North American renewable assets.




The position will also be required to work independently with various corporate functional support groups (e.g., Development, Delivery, Commercial Operations, IT, and Commercial Strategy) to implement ongoing business operation processes and resolve identified issues. In addition, this position will lead all efforts surrounding the development and execution of training related to the business process, systems and tools routinely required to be used by grid scale renewable team members.




This position is eligible to sit in Houston, TX, or Santa Barbara, CA.




What you’ll do:

Assist with the formation, establishment and upkeep of SAP WBS projects/templates and the flow of information from SAP to grid scale renewables development and construction managers to perform their job responsibilities
Analyze and assess actual project CapEx spend to ensure quality and accuracy of data, independently execute forensic accounting tasks to identify outliers and work directly with corporate Accounting/AP and Procurement to rectify errors
Update and modify full life cycle budgets in SAP as supplemental budgets are approved or contingencies are released
Assist with the preparation of routine cash forecasting exercises and Reserve Account preparations
Work with development managers, Accounting and Procurement to transition historic costs and established purchases to full life cycle project budgets and templates. In relationship to this activity, ensure the accounting and purchasing history of all Safe Harbor tax credit equipment are accurately assigned to applicable projects
Assist other Business Operations team members and work with various corporate functions to roll-out new or updated business processes and tools to be used by grid scale renewables
Facilitate the construction of and maintain the documentation/process flows that define various process used to operate our businesses
As required, lead training and orientation efforts surrounding the use of legacy business systems/tools and the roll-out of new enterprise systems. Also responsible for coordinating these efforts with applicable corporate functional groups
Other business operations related tasks as required to support overall objective of ENA’s Grid Scale Renewables business unit
Carry out other duties as assigned

What you bring:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Education, Systems, Science, Economics, or related field required
Experience in a similar role preferred but not required
Detail-oriented individual who will proactively pursue and investigate the underlying details surrounding information being reported in order to construct a comprehensive understanding of project related risks/issues
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders to diagnosis and solve problems within limited time frames
Highly capable of working constructively and maintaining good relationships with both internal and external stakeholders
Experience with Microsoft Office applications
Ability to be trained and be efficient at data capture and analysis exercises using internal dashboards and various enterprise systems (e.g., INCEPTIoN, Green IT, SAP/SAC, Coupa, Procore)
Strong verbal and written communication skills and high level of attention to detail with the ability to present to a wide range of audiences
Results-oriented professional with the ability to work independently within a large matrixed organization while effectively interfacing with the various cross-functional employee groups
Strong desire to advance the adoption and deployment of renewable energy solutions across North America



Additional Information/Conditions:

Must be willing and able to comply with all ENGIE ethics and safety policies
Ability to meet highest attendance requirements
Ability to communicate effectively
Ability to handle multiple assignments on a timely basis with a high degree of accuracy
Ability to travel regularly (up to 25%) within the United States
Ability to engage with stakeholders on evening and weekends
Ability to use company computer

Why ENGIE?

ENGIE North America isn’t just participating in the Zero-Carbon Transition, we’re leading it! Join us as we develop energy that is renewable, efficient, and accessible to everyone.




Unite with us in leading the transformation of the world of energy! ENGIE is looking for talented and motivated individuals to create the future of energy and customer solutions. Join a rewarding and flexible work environment that encourages innovation and creativity to help customers meet their energy challenges today and in the future. Are you up for the challenge?

Job Title: HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst - Graduate Hire
Job Description:
This role has been designated as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2-3 days per week from an HPE office.

Who We Are:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

Job Description:


As an HPC, AI & Labs Business Planning Analyst within the group you will drive strategy, planning and business development for this growth area within this GBU, including market and competitive analysis, business cases for new investments and solutions to achieve growth targets, and business performance analytics and reporting. You will work across the business unit as well as partner with Corporate Strategy and other corporate groups and businesses to align and execute on our strategy.

Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models. Prepares comprehensive implementation tactics, including execution plans, resource allocation plans, follow-up guidelines, assessment, and process accountabilities. Ensures that business activities are aligned with stated plans among different stakeholders. Sets business metrics, evaluates actual performance, and makes recommendations to business leaders on performance target achievement. Develops data-driven analyses to optimize resources and ensure that business plans can be translated into financial value.

Applies intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues. Works on problems of moderately complex scope. Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input. Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action. Follows established guidelines and interprets policies. Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations.

Core Job Responsibilities:

Conducts and summarizes complex data and business analyses to develop business plans, including revenue and demand projections, workforce optimization, and channel management.
Constructs statistical and financial models with minimal direction to forecast business performance.
Defines the metrics required to measure business performance, and compares actual data to forecasted values.
Executes market research projects, gathers intelligence on current industry, technology, and consumer trends, and summarizes research findings tailored to business needs.
Works with cross-functional teams to facilitate the data collection and performance measurement process, and escalates issues as necessary. Makes contributions to research and analyses on priority projects within established guidelines.
Develops portions of project documentation in accordance with provided plan and detailed specifications, including budgets, resource allocation plans, and other support requirements.

Education and Experience Required:
Typically 2-4 years’ experience in strategy, planning, operations, finance, or related functional area or 0-2 years’ experience with a Master’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field.

Knowledge and Skills:

Demonstrated knowledge of research methodology and the ability to manage data requests.
Strong analytical thinking, technical analysis, and data manipulation skills.
Ability to learn and draw on new analytical techniques.
Strong knowledge of Excel, Access, statistical analysis, and financial modeling.
Demonstrated business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Experience or understanding of project planning tools and software packages.

Additional Skills:

Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning, Active Listening, Bias, Business Decisions, Business Development, Business Metrics, Business Performance, Business Strategies, Calendar Management, Coaching, Computer Literacy, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Design Thinking, Empathy, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, Leadership, Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity, Policy and procedures {+ 5 more}

What We Can Offer You:

Health & Wellbeing

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

Personal & Professional Development

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

Let's Stay Connected:

Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

Continue serving as lead and SME for all completed projects, enhancements, business continuity work, and level 4 support.
Recommend process improvements and provide feedback pertaining to standard artifact templates and business processes.
Document and maintain business & IT process flow repositories.
Able to execute above responsibilities for multiple large to enterprise sized projects simultaneously.

Regular onsite attendance required.
Flexible work schedule to support business needs.
Acceptable level of hearing and vision to perform job duties.

Full time

Academy is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate with regard to employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by law.

Job Summary

The Business Process Analyst is responsible for researching, analyzing, documenting, and recommending changes to the organization’s business processes to improve operational efficiencies, quality, service, and profitability. Lead process reengineering efforts, defining new process models that align with industry beset practices and organizational goals. This challenging role is a platform for career growth. It offers the successful candidate broad vision of the inner workings of a premier energy and industrial Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) company serving diverse markets and poised for substantial growth to meet the growing demands of the energy infrastructure.

Job Responsibilities:
Actively supports the Company’s commitment to safety, delivering the best, and its Core Values.
Represents the Company at all times with high moral standards while adhering to the Company’s Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.
Evaluates employee needs, internal workflows, and business processes. Conducts meetings with stakeholders and subject matter experts to collect information/data regarding ineffective or inefficient processes.
Performs Root Cause Analysis on processes with issues requiring deeper evaluation using standard methodologies (e.g., 5-Why, Fishbone Diagram).
Collects and studies operational and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Creates flowcharts, process maps, and diagrams as a method of visualizing ongoing processes to detect internal inefficiencies within the scope of a given workflow. Analyzes business processes and workflows with the objective of finding out how they can be improved or automated.
Assesses business requirements and makes evidence-based recommendations to support process improvements. Draws inferences from process details and links these inferences to the big picture by considering business objectives in identifying process improvements.
Monitors detailed business analyses and collaborates with business and IT leaders to create and document new processes.
Designs and prepares documentation, training materials, and communications supporting new processes.
Interprets complex data and business metrics for relevant stakeholders.
Researches and conducts site observations to identify the equipment, methods, and personnel needed for effective processes.
Examines emerging business best practices and technological developments to automate and streamline processes to help the organization perform more efficiently.
Reviews and edits others’ process documentation for any function in the enterprise.
Performs other duties as required or assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, Management, or a related field, or equivalent combination of education/experience in lieu of a degree.
4+ years’ experience in process analysis and improvement, preferably in the Construction industry.
Ability to conduct and interpret quantitative and qualitative analyses.
Demonstrated proficiency creating process description tools such as flowcharts, work instructions, and procedures using tools such as Visio and Microsoft Office.
Demonstrated aptitude for information flow and interfaces between company functions in a digital environment.
Understanding of process modeling techniques and methodologies (e.g., BPMN, Lean, Six Sigma).
Ability to make an organizational assessment, identify and implement improvement opportunities.
Effective organizational and problem-solving skills utilizing empathy, patience, and persistence in achieving results without authority.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels.
Ability to travel domestically between 10% and 20%.



In addition, full-time employees are offered a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, disability benefits, life and AD&D insurance, an employee assistance program (EAP), a 401(k) plan with company match, an employee stock purchase plan (ESPP), a robust wellness program and adoption assistance. Some employees may also be eligible for paid time off, tuition reimbursement and a performance or safety bonus program.
