Job Title: Analyst II, IT Field Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Analyst II, IT Field Operations

Buckeye is the premier infrastructure and logistics provider for the world’s energy needs, both today and tomorrow. Since 1886, we have successfully navigated transitions in the way energy has been distributed to continually meet the needs of an evolving market and industry environment. Our people are a critical element to the success and longevity of our operational history and our future as we seek to thrive through the energy transition.

We own and operate a diversified global network of integrated assets providing midstream logistic solutions, primarily consisting of the transportation, storage, processing, and marketing of liquid petroleum products. We are committed to safely and responsibly providing world-class service to meet the continually evolving energy needs of our customers and the communities we serve. As part of this commitment to our customers, we are continually diversifying our platform and service offerings to enable less carbon intensive energy solutions, and undertaking decarbonization efforts on our operations.




Buckeye Partners is currently seeking an IT Field Operations Analyst II with experience in software application support and troubleshooting in the Oil & Gas Industry to join our growing team!




Role Summary:

The IT Field Operations Analyst II role performs, or monitors activities and projects related to the operation, integration, implementation, upgrade, and/or enhancements to Buckeye’s IT Field Operations Applications.




Responsibilities & Essential Functions include:

Application Program Management Support. Support issue resolution with the production environment and end users through investigation, analysis, and training end users on how to properly utilize the system.
Responsible for assigned IT Field Operations Application Programs.
Document end user requirements related to new application request.
Engage vendor(s) to develop and maintain operations
Work with vendor(s) to develop and maintain operations applications.
Lead as IT program manager for the applications you support.
Investigate reported application issues.
Provide operations with recent upgrades and work closely with supervision to guarantee proper and realistic site representations.
Internal Support. Recommend to the IT department lifecycle management of assigned and dependent applications.
Vendor Liaison. Work with application support vendor to lead issue resolution including any tracking progress of issue resolution.
Internal Applications Administrator. Coordinate department administrators to ensure proper administration and setup of assigned applications, administering systems interfaces between dashboard services, and coordinating the administration of security. Coordinate with and communicate to IT peers, IT management, Operations staff, and Operations management as needed.
Process Improvements. Based on knowledge and experience, continuously identify potential opportunities to increase efficiencies and/or improvements to existing processes. Identify gaps in the current business model and propose processes that will help move the business forward.
Project Execution. Identify various projects related to Buckeye’s application systems.
System Maintenance. Perform and manage the maintenance of the supported data and databases.
Documentation. Support providing documentation for all supported applications and ensuring documentation is current. Documentation may include IT PMO, Disaster Recovery, Interconnection, etc.
Testing. Test application upgrades prior to releasing to the Buckeye Business and providing recommendations for application system application upgrades and enhancements.
On-Call Support. Provide on-call support during non-business hours to Operations on an as needed basis.
Customer Service. Providing exceptional customer service.
And other duties as assigned.



Position Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technologies or related discipline OR equivalent experience required.
7+ years related experience in software application support and troubleshooting is preferred.
Basic knowledge of pipeline and truck terminal terminology and operations is a significant plus.
Microsoft Excel VBA programming experience preferred.
Microsoft SQL experience is preferred.
Basic knowledge of pipeline and truck terminal terminology and operations is required to be obtain in short order.
Linux OS experience is preferred.
Ability to travel up to 25% both domestically and internationally.



Certificates & Licenses:

None required



Other Skills, Attributes and Abilities:

This position requires good analytical skills to resolve technical and business issues.
Persons in this position are asked to respond to system issues immediately and requires someone who has the ability to meet stringent deadlines and the ability to work well under pressure.
The individual must be able to work in a team-oriented environment and interact on numerous concepts at various levels of the end-user community.
This position requires good oral and written communication skills.



Essential Functions:

This position requires the ability to safely and successfully perform essential job functions consistent with ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and or/quantitative productivity standards.
This role requires the ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
This position requires compliance with all personnel policies.



Physical & Safety Requirements:

The person in this position needs to occasionally move inside the office to access file cabinets, office equipment, etc.
This role continuously operates a computer and other office productivity equipment (i.e. a calculator, copy machine and computer printer).



About You:

To be successful in the Buckeye culture, our employees must possess a demonstrated commitment to environmental responsibility and regulatory compliance. Excellent communication, both written and verbal, as well as strong organizational skills are paramount. You must work independently and be able to exercise tact, discretion, and professionalism when dealing with internal and external customers, and when handling sensitive and confidential information.

Buckeye wants to create and reward an organizational focus that stimulates the creative and entrepreneurial actions of its employees that result in innovative ways of reducing costs, generating revenues, improving productivity, or improving processes.




About Us:

People First Culture:

From managing over 5,000 miles of pipeline to commercializing clean energy projects, our people collaborate to provide world-class service and meet the changing energy needs of our customers. Our employee-first culture means that we invest in our employees and equip them to be fully contributing members of high performing teams. We are focused on collaboration, inclusion, empowerment, accountability, and professional development. We want the best in you to bring out the best in us.

Join us as we work together to build a business that is responsive to the needs of the future while continuing to serve the energy needs of communities today.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. We are also an equal opportunity employer of individuals with disabilities and protected veterans. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP on the following website:

Responsibilities:
At least 2+ years of professional Business Analyst experience

Basic Function




The Senior Business Analyst (Functional Developer) is a key position in the discovery and delivery of business solutions from information technology. Through continuous consultation with the functional areas, has a deep understanding of business operations and is capable of articulating solutions in business terms and not technical jargon. They are capable of envisioning potential value for new IT solutions. While they have a deep understanding of specific business areas, that expertise is set into a broader context of understanding the business processes and technical capabilities that may cross functional boundaries.

Roles & Responsibilities



Supports the Forecast to Plan performing functional activities in Demand Planning and Sales & Operations Planning processes including statistical forecast modeling, supply planning and other such processes
Works closely with business colleagues, to quickly understand new requirements or problems, and then suggest a possible solution
Lead solution design activities with client groups in a specific business area to create and to document the business requirements
Perform development and configuration activities as needed along with working with the technical team for SAP ABAP, Azure integration, SAP CPIDS or web app type solutions
Create Solution Documentation for solutions to ensure approved requirements are met
Maintains relationship with business colleagues with excellent communication
Oversees enhancements and participate in projects activities including development solution documents, functional designs, and work with technical developers to ensure business requirements are clear and development activities are on schedule
Develops and oversees the development of unit test cases and performs testing to ensure requirements are met for system modifications or data extracts.
Consults with the business colleagues on appropriate change management activities to achieve organizational readiness for the implementation of changes.
Demonstrates leadership by coordinating and/or supporting the requirements, specifications, and user acceptance testing efforts
Participates in development of short and long-term plans and roadmaps
Manages incident and problem management for assigned area
Coordinate/act as a broker of services and suppliers, including Enterprise Architecture, Solution Delivery, Service Management, etc.
Min. Qualifications




Required experience, skills, professional attributes, and qualities include the following:




Experience supporting or implementation of Sales and Operation Planning processes and the integration with Supply Chain processes
8+ years of solutions and multiple domain experience with increasing levels of leadership responsibility in systems analysis, defining technical requirements, and performing high level design for complex solutions
8+ years of work experience in roles that had a high level of client or end-user engagement with experience in both support and formal or informal leadership
5+ years’ functional experience in SAP Integrated Business Planning Demand Planning and Sales & Operations Planning modules
Experience working with technical developers designing integration using SAP CPIDS or similar integration as well as Azure integration methods
Must have functional development experience with the following SAP modules/components: Global Available to Promise or ATP in general, Advance Planning and Optimization: Demand Planning, Production Planning/Detailed Scheduling
SAP Sales & Distribution or Material Management experience optional
Experience in the Petrochemical Industry with strong business acumen
Resource planning experience for complex projects
Value Oriented, understands technology is a tool with overriding goal of business success
Partners closely with business partners to analyze new projects and readiness for governance decisions and provides transparency of portfolio investments.
Communicate and defend IT policies and standards and understand how IT services benefit the business.



Education:




Bachelor's Degree required



Work Experience





8+ years of solutions and multiple domain experience




5+ years’ functional experience in SAP Integrated Business Planning Demand Planning and Sales

&Operations Planning modules

Masters Degree Preferred

The Staff Consultant – IT Business Analyst is responsible for supporting Agile projects by assisting with the development, execution, and tracking of agile project plans. This position provides Business Analysis, requirements definition, and software testing support to the user base.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems and Decision Sciences, or a related field is required.
Four+ years of relevant experience may substitute education requirement.
None required.
Preferred experience in Agile project management or consulting.
Experience with agile application delivery processes, system development life cycle, business assessments, and programs such as JIRA, Confluence, Asana, Zephyr, TestRail, Trello, Basecamp, TFS is preferred.
Working knowledge of Scrum or other agile methodologies.
Must have an in-depth understanding of Agile, its values and principles, including backlog grooming, release and sprint planning, burn-up/down charts, and more.
Must be knowledgeable of Qualify Assurance and Quality Control processes.
Must be able to effectively manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adjust priorities appropriately in an evolving work environment with shifting time frames.
Ability to work in both Agile and Waterfall methodologies.
Must be able to lead, build, and manage effective teams for small, medium, and large scale projects.
Must be able to work in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, and continuously changing environment.
Must have excellent communication skills in business and technical environments.
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assists in executing project management tasks to support Agile teams.
Aids in performing assessments of business needs and assists developers to translate these needs into project requirements
Prepares work papers reflecting results of business system development and implementation efforts.
Creates and distributes regular reports on project progress, blockers, milestones, and resource needs.
Helps identify and clear roadblocks for Agile teams.
Communicates effectively and consistently with all project stakeholders.
Serves as a liaison between technical and non-technical departments.
Assists project leaders and teams in identifying resources needed and completing individual responsibilities within a project.
Attends process improvement meetings to identify people, process and technology improvements to be made improve team and project performance.
Builds and maintains trusted relationships with diverse group of clients, co-workers, managers, and subject matter experts.
Participates in the development and implementation of structured testing concepts, methodologies, and manual testing support tools.
Assists in performing functionality testing of new applications and existing software enhancements to ensure they meet business requirements through performing end to end business scenario tests.
Aids in performing regression testing of new applications and existing software enhancements to identify any possible impacts caused by changes.
Records and discusses test results with key individuals involved and recommends necessary next steps to ensure desired results.
Tracks quality assurance metrics such as defect impact and open defect counts.
Assists in maintaining and managing the manual scripts and test results.
Verifies and traces evidence of reproduction of any reported faults in existing software.
Aids in re-testing all fixes required for reported faults, including tests for possible impacts from changes.
Ensures project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately.
Ensures all work meets the customer requirements, guidelines, and standards defined for the team and the company before being released for internal approval.
Ensures all internal customers are kept informed of development issues while promoting transparency at all times regarding project status, issues, and risks to stakeholder.
Other Duties:

Provides courteous and prompt service to all internal and external parties. Prioritizes and addresses requests and assignments in a professional and cooperative manner.
Identifies opportunities and recommends methods to improve service, and work processes. Assists in the implementation of quality improvement initiatives.
May assist co-workers in the completion of tasks and assignments to ensure continuity of service and demonstrating team work skills. Actively supports teamwork throughout the organization.
Perform other services as assigned.
Other Considerations:

May periodically travel and work from different company locations.
May be required to work overtime, and/or on weekends as needed.
Must arrive at EisnerAmper offices or client locations in a timely manner and be ready to perform job responsibilities.
Work Environment: Work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully with or without reasonable accommodations. The work environment is considered to be that of a typical business/office operation. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance
401(k) Retirement Plan
Flexible Spending & Health Savings Account
Paid holidays, vacation, and sick time
Employee assistance program and other firm benefits.

Job summary:

Responsible for performing activities based on direction from Symmetry’s Gulf Coast Region Sales Leaders, and members of the Gulf Coast Region Sales Team, pertaining to a variety of analytical reports used by the Sales Team or in the assessment and resolution of customer requests and issues in a timely, cost-effective manner. Develops reports for internal and external parties, and conducts analytical research related to the energy industry to assist in creating reports and presentations for used to communicate with customers and prospects.

Essential Duties/Responsibilities:

Establishes and maintains a collaborative relationship with members in other departments including scheduling, trading, credit, contracts, and accounting in addressing customer requests and issues, in a timely, cost-effective manner.
Manages customer-related inquiries and issues as directed by Gulf Coast Region Sales Leaders. Analyzes information, collects and cross-references supporting documentation to identify the cause of issue or problem. Makes recommendation or provides resolution, effectively communicates resolution to applicable departments, and promptly provides resolution or feedback to customer(s) and sales representatives.
Evaluates contractual obligations, pricing, and volume/usage data and prepares pricing and volume reports for sales representatives and customers.
Prepares and sends weekly/monthly gas pricing estimate reports (including baseload, daily, imbalance gas cost analysis, fuel, and commodity calculations). Utilizes existing reports or prepares custom reports as requested by customers.
Assists Sales Team in deal entry and management of transactions, including, entry of fixed price transaction requests in Endur and Salesforce, and/or communication of transaction details in Outlook and/or Endur and Salesforce. Works with Sales and IT to develop margin tracking spreadsheet related to fixed price transactions. Creates and updates future fixed-price position reports for sales representatives and customers to assist with decisions for future gas purchase volumes and storage inventory management.
Assists in entry and management of customer-related information in Salesforce and generates reports in Salesforce to assist Sales Leaders and Sales Team.
Assists Sales Team in development and management of sales prospecting data. Additionally, works with Sales Team and Marketing Department to develop sales material to be used as part of targeted sales/marketing campaign and/or in direct interaction with identified customers and/or prospects.
Reviews and verifies customer invoices for volume and pricing accuracy prior to being sent to customers.
Utilizes problem-solving and multi-tasking skills to manage daily work requirements along with interruptions of additional requests.
Performs other related duties as required.

Sales Analyst

Fiesta Mart, Inc. Houston, Texas, United States (On-site)

The Sales Analyst is responsible for providing insights and recommendations to drive sales performance. This role involves overseeing data collection processes, analyzing sales data, and collaborating with stakeholders to inform strategic decision-making while ensuring data accuracy and integrity. The sales analyst is responsible for optimizing data-driven initiatives and fostering a collaborative team environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES:

Develop and implement sales analysis strategies and methodologies to identify market trends, sales opportunities, and areas for improvement.
Oversee the collection, organization, and analysis of data to generate accurate and actionable reports and recommendations.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in reports and establish and maintain standardized analysis processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align sales analysis efforts with overall business objectives.
Identify and implement process improvements to streamline analysis procedures, increase efficiency, and enhance data-driven decision-making.
Act as a point of contact for internal teams, addressing inquiries, and concerns, and providing insights to support strategic decision-making.
Monitor and analyze competitor activities, market conditions, and customer preferences to identify new business opportunities and potential risks.
Utilize data visualization tools and techniques to effectively communicate sales analysis findings.
Develop and implement data collection strategies, methodologies, and standard operating procedures to ensure consistency and quality across the team.
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with internal stakeholders, such as Directors and Buyers, to understand their data requirements and provide support as needed.
Conduct quality control checks on collected data to identify and resolve any inconsistencies, errors, or anomalies.
Develop and maintain documentation of data collection processes, guidelines, and best practices for reference and training purposes.
Analyze and interpret data collection metrics and performance indicators to identify areas for improvement and optimize data collection processes.
Develop and maintain relationships with external data collection vendors or partners, if applicable, to support data collection efforts.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS & EDUCATION:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Statistics, Data Science). MBA preferred.
Proven experience managing any type of analytical team.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software.
Excellent leadership and team management abilities.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality.
Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally.

SKILLS:

Data Analysis: Proficiency in data analysis techniques, tools, and software to effectively analyze sales data and extract meaningful insights.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey complex data analysis findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Statistical Analysis: Familiarity with statistical analysis methods to conduct advanced data analysis and generate accurate insights.
Project Management: Ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple data collection projects, ensuring adherence to timelines and deliverables.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify data-related issues, propose solutions, and optimize data collection processes.
Collaboration: Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including sales managers, executives, and data analysts, to align data collection efforts with organizational goals.
Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with data privacy regulations.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Tableau, Access, and Macros) and familiarity with data collection software and platforms.
Leadership: Ability to inspire and motivate a team, foster a collaborative work environment, and drive a culture of continuous improvement.
Business Acumen: Understanding of business objectives, sales metrics, and key performance indicators to guide data collection and analysis efforts.
Critical Thinking: Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills to evaluate complex sales data, identify patterns, and provide strategic recommendations.
Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities, business needs, and evolving data analysis techniques.

JOB SUMMARY
At Houston Methodist, the Operations Project Analyst position is responsible for providing administrative support to the department by managing strategic projects directly tied to the department's operational focus. This position coordinates office duties which require considerable initiative, experience, judgment, organizational skills, and knowledge of organization policies and practices. Utilizing many internal and external data sources and software tools, the Operations Project Analyst position serves a vital role in supporting the management team. This position relies on appropriate resources to collect relevant data, compile information for management decisions, and ensure the successful execution of related events. The projects for the Operations Project Analyst position are directly linked to the evolution of the department's/division's operational focus. Related duties for the Operations Project Analyst position involve meeting/event preparation including formulating reports and data for presentation for a variety of audiences in support of department initiatives.

The Operations Project Analyst will assist in developing and maintaining internal dashboards for the Patient Experience Department. There are various patient experience dashboards that are regularly updated to reflect operations as well as reports that need to be managed when onboarding new providers. This position will be responsible for making sure all data is accurate and available to the organization on a regular basis via the shared drive and answer any questions regarding data interpretation. This position will also be responsible for obtaining reports for the finance reporting team. Data analysis will be performed as well which requires attention to detail and developing a narrative around the patient’s voice to assist the organization on various projects that work on improving the patient experience. Experience with excel is highly preferred as most projects are conducted in excel.




PRIMARY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Job responsibilities labeled EF capture those duties that are essential functions of the job.

PEOPLE - 15%

Promotes a positive work environment and contributes to a dynamic, team focused work unit that actively helps one another to achieve optimal department results. Collaborates with others by actively communicating and reporting pertinent information and data in a comprehensive manner. (EF)
Effectively engages key contacts to obtain information that relates to strategic initiatives as highlighted by management. (EF)
Represents department management at assigned committees, meetings, and other entity-related events to provide contributions or input as required. (EF)


SERVICE - 35%

Participates on committees and task forces as assigned, ensuring that critical objectives are clearly understood and action items appropriately delegated. Follows up on action items as necessary to ensure completion of assignments. (EF)
Coordinates department meetings and events to include scheduling, room assignments, equipment and catering needs. Composes meeting minutes for committees and department meetings as assigned. (EF)
Conveys information to director and management by assembling and summarizing data. Uses a variety of software applications to create/compose both routine and non-routinemanagement level communications and reports. (EF)


QUALITY/SAFETY - 30%

Maintains associated paperwork, creates files, and develops effective presentation tools and/or reports for significant activities. Utilizes technology resources to conduct research for assigned projects. (EF)
Collects relevant data, compiles information for management decisions, and ensures the successful execution of related events/activities using appropriate resources. Reconciles data to determine if actual results are as expected/anticipated. (EF)
Performs routine administrative tasks contributing to the efficient flow of department operations. Develops reports and other presentation materials for director/management to showcase the need for change as appropriate. (EF)


FINANCE - 10%

Maintains and reports key financial and/or operational metrics/processes as directed by management. May assist management in routine financial endeavors such as processing invoices and/or budget activities. (EF)
Displays self-motivation to independently manage time effectively and prioritize daily tasks. Adheres to organizational guidelines regarding financial issues. (EF)
Contributes towards meeting department financial targets through optimizing efficiency and other areas according to department specifications. Utilizes efficient and cost-effective work practices with department resources and supplies; provides recommendations to reduce expenses. (EF)


GROWTH/INNOVATION - 10%

Improves operations by analyzing results and variances, identifies trends, and recommends actions. (EF)
Seeks continuing education opportunities to expand learning beyond baseline competencies with a focus on continual development. (EF)

Analyze business and other data processing problems to develop and implement solutions to complex application problems. Perform systems management and integration functions. Execute proficiency in Oracle E-business Suite (AP, Purchasing, Order Management, Shipping, and Inventory). Collect and analyze business requirements for Oracle financial projects. Utilize Procure-to-Pay cycle and Manufacturing Process Management. Apply 2+ ERP Financials implementations and provide guidance to support business solutions and efficiencies. Interpret business needs and identify and deliver technical solutions. Define system strategies; develop processes to collate and document business requirements; lead fit-gap analysis; apply as-is and to-be business process models; conference room pilots (CRPs) functional configuration. Design/develop testing scenarios for Oracle financial projects; prepare test scripts in response to business needs.

Mail resumes to: Nabors, Attn: Talent Acquisition, 515 W. Greens Road, Houston, TX 77067. Must indicate job code [6606.567.5].

Primary Location: United States Of America-Texas-Houston-(Nabors Corporate Services) Houston Office

Location: Houston, TX, US, 77010
Req ID: 84113
Facility: One Houston Center-130
Department: Finance Business Intelligence
Division: Finance

LyondellBasell.

Come Join an Inclusive Team:

The Finance Data Analytics and Automation (DA&A) Team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, process mining and reporting to generate insights which facilitates better decision-making and value creation. The team also governs and supports key financial reporting systems used by Finance and will act as focal point in strategic initiatives / projects. The Lead Analyst, Finance Business Intelligence will report to the Manager, Finance Business Intelligence and will be a core member of the OneStream Projects and Development group. The OneStream Projects and Development group delivers technical leadership for ongoing enhancements of applications used in financial reporting such as OneStream, SAP BW/BPC, and CCERT. The Lead Analyst will interact with vendor(s) on design of the OneStream application, provide training to OneStream users, and advise on new features of OneStream to be considered for future implementations or enhancements. Additionally, they will assist the OneStream Center of Excellence (COE) team with the management and governance of the OneStream application. The Lead Analyst will support COE team efforts related to the OneStream Community of Practice (CoP) and super-user group. This role will also contribute to the development of any ongoing OneStream applications. The Lead Analyst will have the additional opportunity to learn and technically support the automation and analytical tools used by DA&A like RPA, Alteryx, Automation Anywhere, Microsoft Power Platform, Celonis, and Azure SQL.

Day in the Life:
Stay up to date with Business Intelligence and related tools such as OneStream, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Platform, and Azure.
Stay up to date with Corporate Management Systems like OneStream and SAP BW. Also be familiar with and able to leverage knowledge of other technologies such as Intelligent Automation, process mining, and data & analytics.
Must have experience working in OneStream or a comparable CPM system with direct experience working in modeling, reporting, visualization, and dashboarding. OneStream implementation, consolidation, and/or FP&A experience is a plus.
Must have experience working with teams from different groups / vendors spread across different geographical locations, with varying levels of familiarity with OneStream.
Must be able to review the design and implementation proposals recommended by external vendor keeping system performance and data quality in mind.
Should be able to help explore and implement OneStream Marketplace solutions like AcctRecs, Transaction Matching, ACM and others.
Should have knowledge of SQL and VB scripting; at least within the confines of the OneStream application.
Working experience with Power BI is preferred; must have a desire to develop this skill set.
Must be able to assist in the development of training materials and teach new users in OS COE group on basics-to-advanced OneStream processes / concepts.
Would act as OneStream subject matter expert (SME) for LYB OneStream COE and extended peer group, including the OneStream Community of Practice (CoP).
Should be able to help with OneStream Support activities related to Month End Close including monitoring loads, updating transformation mappings, running ad hoc loads and data management jobs.
Nice to have knowledge related to FP&A processes like monthly forecasting, budgeting and management reporting.
Must have experience with company consolidation of financials.
Experience with end-user support / request prioritization using tools like ServiceNow and Azure DevOps (ADO) is a plus.
Nice to have OneStream and/or HFM Expertise.
Must have knowledge of various OneStream functionalities including data integration, Workflows, Business rules, Data Source, Transformations, Dimensions, Member Filters, Cube Views, Quick Views, XF get cell, Dashboards and various other administrative functions (including OS security).
Must have OneStream knowledge on advanced Member Filters, Dynamic Calculations and Formatting settings for Cube Views, BI Viewer and advanced Components, Dashboard Layouts and Embedded Dashboards, and OneStream features used in Report Books.
Must have experience with OneStream Finance Engine including Dynamic Calculations, Stored Calculations and Finance Business Rules.
Must have experience designing and implementing Dashboards in Onstream with advanced data queries, Business Rules and Workspaces.
Must be very comfortable with the concepts of a Dashboard Maintenance Unit, using Business Rules such as Dashboard Extenders, XFBR Strings and / or Dashboard Data Sets, advanced Dashboard Components and SQL data queries.
You Bring This Value:
BS Accounting, Finance, MIS, or related Degree.
6-8 years of experience.
CPA or similar accreditation is a plus.
Strong Project Management skills.
Deep OneStream knowledge.
Technical SQL and VB scripting knowledge.
Understanding of FP&A and / or Consolidations processes.
Presentation skills, including the ability to break down complicated subjects and explain them succinctly to non-experts and project leadership.
SAP Experience is a plus.
Excellent oral and written communications with the ability to explain technical concepts in business terms.
Experience working with geographically diverse, cross-functional, and technical teams.
Chemical industry experience / knowledge is beneficial.

CGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.

CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.
Skills and attributes for success:
Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders.
Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements
Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports
Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders
Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation
Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement
Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation
Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content
Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements
Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation
Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues
Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes.
Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts
Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration
Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationships

Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering)
Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance
7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes
Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods
Experience with Jira or other Agile tools
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users.
Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently.
Must possess exceptional attention to detail
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams
Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis
Experience in managing client requirements and small teams
Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skills

Ideally, you will also have:
Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies
Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution
Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences
Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle
Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)

Our Commitment:
Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.

For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

USA Compression Partners, LP, (NYSE: USAC) provides mission-critical natural gas compression services to large upstream and midstream energy companies. We are an operations-centric, technology-driven employer with 800+ employees in 18 states across the US. We owe our success to the quality of our employees, our strong commitment to safety, and our superior service to our customers.

Key Business Objectives:

A hybrid between FP&A and Corporate Development, this role supports operations by performing complex financial modeling and assisting with all operational and financial analysis functions. This role will be responsible for preparing, analyzing, and communicating operational and financial results and forecasts to operations management, maintaining pricing and portfolio analytics, and supporting corporate development activities. This individual will challenge current conventions, successfully manage through system and process changes and partner with internal stakeholders to contribute to achieving the company’s long-term strategic goals. To the ideal candidate, we are offering a challenging opportunity, upward mobility, and a dynamic employee culture. This position is based in Houston, TX.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Planning & Reporting

Maintain and design/build company financial forecast models for the annual budget, quarterly public guidance, intra-month forecasting, and long-range strategic planning initiatives.
Own the refinement and ongoing oversight of the Company's annual planning process; creating, updating, and maintaining financial models and detailed forecasts of the company's future operations to support the business decision making (operational and strategic).
Support the monthly financial reporting process to provide updates on actual performance and comparisons to guidance forecasts.
Create top quality Excel reports and PowerPoint presentations and effectively communicate results and conclusions to our executives.
Assess, critique, and deploy proposed business KPIs; set up plans and strategic actions to improve performance and ensure KPI targets are reached.
Collaborate effectively across multiple groups and functions to develop value-add analytics and insight on business performance.
Perform ad-hoc deep dive analysis that connects understanding of core financial indicators and their relationship to the underlying business.
Support company-wide initiative to converge processes and identify opportunities to standardize and streamline reporting.

Pricing & Portfolio Analysis

Own the pricing profitability and portfolio valuation metrics.
Build / maintain tools to provide pricing guidance to regional sales teams.
Manage and value one-off, periodic quote requests for unique, non-standard commercial opportunities.
Create models to review actual returns on assets and portfolios, ensuring that the pricing strategies achieve return and cash flow targets.

Corporate Development

Conduct in-depth financial analysis, including valuation, pro forma financial modeling, and scenario analysis, to evaluate potential transactions and investment opportunities.
Support due diligence, review, integration and carve-out initiatives as needed.

Other Additional Responsibilities

Lead, manage and/or support multiple work streams and structure work plans effectively.
Build complex Excel models and improve existing ones.
Assist in the training and development of new analysts if required.
Provide analytical assistance to people outside the commercial and operations organization as needed.
Any other duties or responsibilities as assigned by the supervisor.
Full-time salary position.



Skills/Capabilities and Education:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or Business
Either Energy or Midstream Industry experience required
Minimum 3-5 years of finance/accounting experience
Prefer at least 3 or more years of financial planning and analysis, business analysis, financial modeling and business planning, including monthly financial performance analysis of Profit and Loss Statements, Cash Flow and Balance Sheets
Excellent interpersonal skills to manage internal relationships with those contributing to and owning corporate performance
Outstanding analytical skills. Ability to look through data to build cases, explain past performance, and forecast results.
Excellent modeling, presentation, and communication skills.
Must have exceptional Excel and PowerPoint skills.
Finance experience - be able to run any capital budgeting type of analysis, create forecasts or do any kind of valuation work as needed.
Reliable - the candidate should be able to proficiently go through large amounts of data and build accurate reports/analyses without errors, often under pressure with short event timelines.
Strong business acumen, intellectually curious, hardworking, coachable, a good listener, team-oriented, self-confident/motivated, and approachable.
Applicant must have the ability to legally work in the U.S.



Working Conditions:

Dynamic, fast-paced, demanding environment.
The incumbent spends most of the time sitting or standing in a comfortable position with ample opportunity to move about.
Periodic lifting requirements of up to 25 lbs.
Travel may be required but is expected to be less than 25% of the time worked.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate is likely to have received a college degree with a focus in network design, or equivalent experience. Candidates must be self-motivated, demonstrate excellent multitasking skills, and should be comfortable working in a fast-paced, state-of-the-art electronic trading environment
2 years of network engineering experience in a professional environment
Change Management experience is must.

Understanding of TCP/IP and the OSI stack
Understanding of routing protocols (BGP, OSPF)
Some experience working with either Juniper, Aruba or Cisco
Understanding of switching, firewalls, STP, VLANs, VPNs, Trunks, ACLs, multicast routing (IGMP, PIM)
Familiarity dealing with multiple vendors
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Experience performing network traffic and protocol analysis using standard industry tools (Wireshark, tcpdump)
Basic understanding of Linux/Unix
Desire to obtain a CCNA or CCNP

Contribute to creating a sustainable tomorrow:

TES is a global green energy company leading the way in the production of e-NG (electric natural gas derived from green hydrogen). Headquartered in Europe, TES is committed to making reliable and affordable green energy accessible to all by implementing giga-scale projects using a proven, scalable and cost-effective method. With a presence in the United States, Middle East, Asia and Australia, the company’s green hydrogen model uses solar and wind energy in low-cost areas with abundant sunlight or wind. The green hydrogen is then combined with climate-neutral CO2 and transformed into e-NG, a renewable molecule, easy to transport and store using existing infrastructure. Through the supply of e-NG to various industries, TES aims to win the climate race ensuring the mass adoption of green molecules across the globe.

Embarking on a journey to fulfill its grand aspirations, TES continues to build a global team of exceptional talents. Simultaneously, the organization is set to expand exponentially - transitioning from a current strength of 120+ dedicated individuals to a thriving workforce numbering in the several hundred within the upcoming years.


What you will do:


The Capital Markets Analyst role is an exciting role supporting TES’ growth in the Americas. The Analyst will be involved with capital raise processes, cash flow analysis, business modeling, and corporate growth initiatives. The ideal candidate should possess a strong finance background with previous work and transaction experience in investment banking, corporate finance, project finance, or capital markets.

As a Capital Markets Analyst, you will work closely with U.S. and Global management as part of the Corporate Finance team and will be responsible for:

Supporting the execution of financing transactions (including equity raises and debt / project finance) and development of financing / funding strategies.
Build and maintain complex financial models to support the company’s financing strategy and investment decisions.
Conducting financial, market and technical analyses to support strategic decisions.
Developing strong market knowledge and insights into where TES operates.
Work closely with senior management regarding the company’s strategic growth, financial forecasts, and capital markets recommendations.
Prepare management, board of director and investor relations materials.
Work closely with Accounting, Commercial, Regulatory, Legal and Engineering teams.
Coordinating with external stakeholders such as corporate and investment bankers, consultants, law firms, other advisors & data providers.

Location:

Houston, TX (USA)

Who you are:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Engineering or Business Administration from an accredited College or University.
1-2 years in Investment Banking or 3-5 years in Corporate Development or Finance.
Experience in Oil & Gas, Renewables, Power & Utilities, or Infrastructure is preferred.
Experience in executing capital markets financing and/or project finance transactions.
Strong business analysis and modeling skills, proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Expertise in discounted cash flow and valuation more broadly.
Strong time management skills and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects concurrently.
Highly organized and motivated with analytical and critical thinking abilities.
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to work independently as well as in teams.
Positive attitude with the flexibility and adaptability to respond to changing work environments.
Strong written and verbal skills.

What we offer:

Inspiring and diverse work environment in a fast-growing company that will play a key role in securing the world’s green energy supply and achieving its sustainability & decarbonization targets.
Opportunity to work with a very talented team of serial founders and top-notch senior management.
Have an impact on the organization’s short-term and long-term success.
TES-H2 is an equal opportunity employer and encourages diversity in the applications process.

Join our journey towards a green future. Apply now!

Job Description


The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for managing and supporting Quality and Manufacturing initiatives throughout all Cornerstone Building Brands business segments. The Sr. Data Analyst is expected to work with and learn from Business Leaders how to manage data and facilitate reporting that will support events focused on process improvement. The Sr. Data Analysist is responsible for data collection and analytics supporting the Quality and Manufacturing organization. All activities performed by the Quality Analyst are in support of fostering a cultural transformation for Cornerstone Building Brands to be a leader in exemplifying world-class Quality and continuous improvement behaviors.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Develop analytical models, automating reporting and providing simple yet effective visualizations for stakeholders, using Power BI, SharePoint, Excel, SQL and other software programs
Use effective communication skills, working closely with internal customers to understand the business need and determine what data can best be used to drive quality business decisions
This role will require a range of capabilities including but not limited to exploratory data analysis, data trending, statistical analysis, regression, and other mathematical techniques
Ability to work in teams to understand, define and implement solutions to problems
Define and track KPI (key performance indicators) for all quality essentials
Prepare and communicate reports on quality activities and efficiencies
Identify, lead and drive CTO (Cost Take Out) or CoPQ (Cost of Poor Quality) initiatives across business units


Qualifications

5 year of experience with analytics systems (particularly PowerBI, with recognition of experience with Tableau and other relevant experience)
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or data Analytics strongly preferred
Strong understanding of processes of data collection, management, cleaning, organization, reporting, visualization, and analysis
Strong computer and analytic skills including Power BI, SharePoint, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project management software. With the ability to learn new skills and programs quickly to adapt to technological advancements
Ability to work effectively to meet deadlines and exhibit strong judgment and decision-making skills
Self-motivated with a high degree of ownership and accountability for results
Highly flexible and able to react constructively and with a positive attitude to multiple demands, shifting priorities, changed and unexpected events
Knowledge of predictive analytics a plus
Knowledge of RPA/automation, PowerApps, Power Automate a plus
Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

Additional Information


Why work for Cornerstone Building Brands?
Our teams are at the heart of our purpose to positively contribute to the communities where we live, work and play. Full-time* team members receive** medical, dental and vision benefits starting day 1. Other benefits include PTO, paid holidays, FSA, life insurance, LTD, STD, 401k, EAP, discount programs, tuition reimbursement, training, and professional development. You can also join one of our Employee Resource Groups which help support our commitment to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment.

*Full-time is defined as regularly working 30+ hours per week. **Union programs may vary depending on the collective bargaining agreement.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Company Name: Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County, Texas
Job Description:
Job Title: Senior Operations Management Analyst (Please apply directly to the website to be considered.)

https://jobs.ridemetro.org/job/Houston-Senior-Operations-Management-Analyst-TX-77001/1041129900/

Basic Function

Conducts, develops, reviews, and analyzes annual budget and monthly expenses. Performs monthly journal entries and annual year end accruals. Responsible for providing analytical and statistical studies and reports for Operations senior management. Researches and analyzes statistical data, database reports, budget, and variance reports. Performs analytical and statistical studies identifying trends and/or inefficiencies. Performs duties in a safe, efficient manner and in compliance with all applicable rules and safety procedures.

Responsibilities and Specific Duties

Develops, analyzes and prepares the annual Operations Operating budget for assigned divisions. Assists the Manager, Operations Management Support with the annual Operations Capital budget (Capital Improvement five-year plans) and develop budget cashflow.
Works with Operations Project Manager to monitor and update project activities.
Monitors and oversees budget and expenditures and analyzes departmental fund centers and general ledger accounts to ensure conformance within budgetary limits.
Responsible for month-end and year-end closing and prepares journal entries including accrual data for Operations department to provide technical support and oversight of OMS work.
Submits department requests for shopping carts and purchase order change requests.
Prepares Budget Change Requests (BCR’s) including cash flow for department as required.
Provides reports to senior management of assigned divisions and OMS management with financial analyses with recommendations for resolution of financial impact issues.
Assists and supports the Vice President, Operations Management in day-to-day activities and prepares monthly Operations Dashboard report.
Assists senior management in conducting analysis of Operations departmental activities such as service quality performance statistics.
Assists management in monthly Operations variance analysis for assigned fund centers and general ledger accounts.
Assists in preparation of monthly Operations KPI reports.
Maintains necessary documentation and report files for analysis, compliance and audit purposes.
Performs other special projects, financial and/or organizational studies in coordination with EVP Operations, Customer Service and HOV/HOT Lanes divisions as required.
Provides excellent customer service to METRO internal and external customers.
Promotes safety awareness and follows safety procedures in an effort to reduce or eliminate accidents
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

Education Requirement

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Economics, Math, Business or a related degree is required.

Years & Experience Required

Minimum six (6) years in management/financial/operational analysis in a transit or operating environment. Experience should include the use of analytical tools, spreadsheets, Pivot tables, graphics, database packages and simulation analysis.

Knowledge & Skills Required

Proficient in data computation, technical and analytical capabilities. Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office suite, statistical, database spreadsheets and presentation software. Excellent communications (written/verbal), organizational and interpersonal skills are required.

Additional Information

Non-Safety Sensitive

The Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County has a "zero tolerance" drug and alcohol program for all employees. All applicants will be required to undergo drug testing prior to employment and will be subject to further drug and/or alcohol testing throughout their employment. Employees who perform safety-sensitive functions must also submit to drug and/or alcohol testing in accordance with the Department of Transportation (DOT) and the Federal Transit Administration (FTA) regulatory requirements. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, veteran status or disability. © 2023 Metropolitan Transit Authority of Harris County. All Rights Reserved.

Come for the culture, grow your career, and enjoy the journey
When you join PROS, you’re joining a community of people who genuinely care – about their work, communities, customers, and each other. We empower our teams to be their best from anywhere, and trust that wherever you are, you’re going to bring your best self and do your best work.
We take care of our people so you can focus on our customers, business priorities and the important things outside of work. We prioritize flexibility and wellbeing to help our people:
Rest: Quarterly Recharge Days, company-wide mental health holidays to unplug

Reap rewards: Competitive benefits and compensation packages, including paid maternity and paternity leave, adoption and IVF benefits, baby bucks, 401(k) match, pet insurance and more
Reach your full potential: Leadership training, dedicated people leader programs and resources, Learn and Connect cultural series, active Employee Resource Groups
We celebrate and embrace different views and ideas, and all play a role in fostering an inclusive environment that encourages and protects diversity of thought. Our inclusive culture is one of the reasons we’re a Great Place to Work.
Our customers tell us over and over that they ultimately choose PROS because of our people. They love our solutions, but at the end of the day, they don’t choose our technology—they choose us. And that is the ultimate compliment.
We invite you to join our team and grow your career at PROS! Help us shape the future of how companies compete and win in their markets!
Facilities Operations Analyst
Reporting to the Senior Manager, Facilities Operations, the Facilities Operations Analyst will be an Office liaison working with global team members by understanding documented processes and policies and identifying areas for improvement. This position requires data entry, vendor relations, and the ability to identify and implement suggestions for improvement on existing processes and policies.
A Day in the Life of the Facilities Operations Analyst - About the role
Maintain and update technical documents detailing department processes and policies.
Vendor Relations - Work with existing Facilities vendors on requisition creation, invoice submission invoicing, and payment tracking. Work with cross-functional teams to submit quotes, process invoices, and submit service agreements via Workday.
Onboarding new vendors as needed. Provide requisite Procurement and legal documentation for contract execution. Act as liaison between vendor, Procurement, and Legal throughout stages of onboarding. Understanding GDPR requirements and updating departmental data map as new vendors are onboarded.
Assist with forecasting Global office expenses for the organization.
Assist with tracking ongoing expenses. Resolve invoicing issues as needed and reconcile against the department budget.
Act as backup for processing all departmental Purchase Card expenses and reconcile against the department budget
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data and insights on facility performance.
Utilize data analysis tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in facility operations.
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to management.
Subject matter expert for conference room booking technology to assist from an administrative perspective on behalf of PROS.
Assist with CSR (corporate social responsibility) and ESG (environmental, social, governance) requirements. Act as backup for Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery from a global departmental perspective.
Assist with departmental graphic design needs for presentations and internal pages. Provide ongoing updates and maintenance for department sites in Microsoft SharePoint and Microsoft Modern Pages.
Administrative Support - Provide administrative support services in all PROS locations and assist with special projects as needed or requested.
Assist with special projects and requests as needed.
Required Qualifications - About you
We are looking for candidates who possess the rare combination of the following achievements, skills, and behaviors:
Attention to detail and excellent communication skills
Highly organized
Ability to multitask
Excellent customer service for internal and external stakeholders
Able to meet deadlines and ability to work without direct oversight
Moderate skills in Microsoft Office Suite
Assist with managing and onboarding vendors
Administrative support experience
Finance knowledge, with familiarity in General Ledger accounting, forecasting, budgeting, and Accounts Payable/Receivable
Security/Badging – Working knowledge in badging systems, physical security requirements, and related processes and policies
Basic graphic design needs using Canva, Microsoft SharePoint, SharePoint Modern Pages, and PowerPoint
Administrative support in conference room booking software or oversite of a physical conference center
Assisted with purchase card expense report and reconciliation
Strongly Desired Skills & Qualifications
Workday
OnGuard
iOffice
Moderate to strong skills in Microsoft Office Suite including Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, and SharePoint Modern Pages

Ownership
Care

System One is looking to hire a Business Analyst for an enterprise-level company in Spring, TX. This position is hybrid, 3 days in-office, 2 days work-from-home. Candidates will need to be a US Citizen or have their Green Card. Job Capsule The Business Analyst role analyzes, specifies, and validates the business needs of project stakeholders, whether external customers or end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering and compiling user requirements to convey to the development teams throughout the software lifecycle. The Business Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Business Analyst also plays a pivotal role in ensuring the team’s understanding of business requirements. Job Duties/Roles Collaborates with product/project managers and project sponsors to determine scope and vision. Conducts interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, work flow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods. Identifies and establishes scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics. Works with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize collected requirements. Assists in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts. Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards. Creates process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team. Works with project managers to manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary. Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements, verbally or through written documentation, to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required (KSAR) Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development. Experience with tools such as Jira, Confluence, SharePoint, and AdobeXD preferred. Experience with Agile, Scrum, Kanban and Waterfall methodologies. Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products in an enterprise environment. Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language. Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into systems issues and products as required. Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing and managing resources. Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Demonstrated ability to work well with others Minimum Years of Experience Minimum of five (5) years previous work-related experience in the aforementioned tasks. Required/Preferred Education Requirements Bachelor’s degree or recognized equivalent, from an accredited university, in business administration, computer science, finance, or information systems or equivalent industry experience is preferred.

Job Title: Analyst II, IT Field Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Analyst II, IT Field Operations

Buckeye is the premier infrastructure and logistics provider for the world’s energy needs, both today and tomorrow. Since 1886, we have successfully navigated transitions in the way energy has been distributed to continually meet the needs of an evolving market and industry environment. Our people are a critical element to the success and longevity of our operational history and our future as we seek to thrive through the energy transition.

We own and operate a diversified global network of integrated assets providing midstream logistic solutions, primarily consisting of the transportation, storage, processing, and marketing of liquid petroleum products. We are committed to safely and responsibly providing world-class service to meet the continually evolving energy needs of our customers and the communities we serve. As part of this commitment to our customers, we are continually diversifying our platform and service offerings to enable less carbon intensive energy solutions, and undertaking decarbonization efforts on our operations.




Buckeye Partners is currently seeking an IT Field Operations Analyst II with experience in software application support and troubleshooting in the Oil & Gas Industry to join our growing team!




Role Summary:

The IT Field Operations Analyst II role performs, or monitors activities and projects related to the operation, integration, implementation, upgrade, and/or enhancements to Buckeye’s IT Field Operations Applications.




Responsibilities & Essential Functions include:

Application Program Management Support. Support issue resolution with the production environment and end users through investigation, analysis, and training end users on how to properly utilize the system.
Responsible for assigned IT Field Operations Application Programs.

North Shore Steel is an industry-leading metals service center in the Houston area with a 65-year history of serving customers at the highest level. Our mission is to create significant value for our customers, provide a prosperous workplace for our employees, and positively impact society. North Shore Steel is seeking an experienced professionals to join our team.

GENERAL DESCRIPTION: This position reports directly to VP of Information Technology. This is a mid-to-senior level programming position for someone with talent, motivation, and a strong programming background. Corporate software is written primarily in the latest version of Delphi with a SQL Server database. We have several large, home-grown ERP systems written in Delphi that need further development and maintenance.

We are seeking an ideal candidate who possesses an insatiable curiosity and a proactive mindset, going beyond surface-level understanding. They should demonstrate a genuine interest in grasping the intricacies of our business. Additionally, the candidate should be energetic and fearless, embracing challenges with confidence. Collaborating effectively with top-level executive management is crucial for this role. It is important for the candidate to have a solid understanding of the relevant subjects and be prepared to tackle any necessary tasks to successfully fulfill the job requirements. Demonstrating a track record of achieving significant goals within specified timelines is also highly valued in the ideal candidate.

PRIMARY DUTIES:

Programming, modifying, testing, and debugging internal business applications for a dynamic steel service center.
Gathering requirements, design, documentation, and technical support.
SKILLS:

Programming experience with Delphi.
Experience with database design and SQL.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of software development best practices.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially in collaborating with business users.
Self-motivated and capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team.
Mobile device development experience.
Business analysis, i.e., ability to understand business challenges and propose software solutions to solve them.
User interface design.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
A bachelor’s degree in computer science with a focus in programming and 5 or more years of relevant programming experience or 8 or more years of programming experience.

BENEFITS: North Shore provides rich benefits to its full-time employees and their families, including, but not limited to, multiple Major Medical plans, Dental, Vision, Vol Life, Short Term Disability, and a Flex Spending Account. We also provide a Basic Life policy and Long Term Disability at no cost to you. The benefits don’t stop there, with the added value of a generous holiday schedule, PTO policy, and a 401k plan.

Position Description

The Department of Finance at Harris County Precinct 4 is responsible for budgeting, accounting, and procurement operations. The Accounting Analyst (Operations) plays a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of procurement processes. This position reports directly to the Finance Operations Manager and is primarily responsible for processing journal entries, executing general budget transfers and collaborating with other divisions within Precinct 4 to allocate resources effectively and provide procurement assistance. Ensures timely updates with the Finance Operations Manager and makes recommendations for needed accounting changes. This position demands adept management of competing priorities when workflow or deadlines change.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The duties listed below are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed.

Resource Allocation Coordination:
Ensure proper allocation of consolidated costs within Precinct 4’s divisions as needed.
Prepare and submit necessary journal entries to the County Auditor for entry.
Propose new or corrected allocations of costs for review with Finance Operations Manager.
Procurement Assistance:
Collaborate with Precinct 4’s staff and County’s Purchasing Agent to facilitate financial aspects of procurement activities.
Workflow and Process Management:
Analyze workflow processes and assist with the development of new processes and procedures.
Reporting and Documentation:
Provide performance-reporting metrics, correspondence, and other documentation as required.
Assist in internal audit processes, including providing documentation and explanation for general cost allocations.
Continuous Learning and Compliance:
Stay up-to-date with relevant accounting and purchasing knowledge and industry best practices.
Ensure general accounting activities comply with County policies, accounting standards, and relevant regulations.
General Support:
Establish and maintain positive working relationships with Precinct 4 staff, other Harris County departments and vendors, to address inquiries, resolve issues and foster collaboration.
Provide support for other accounts payable, budget, and purchasing functions as needed.
