About the role

Provide ongoing management of real estate transaction activities for our corporate client's portfolio of properties. Prepare, recommend, and implement a portfolio-wide transaction strategy for acquiring and disposing of commercial properties. Coordinate field resources and other collaborators in the execution of lease renewals, new site acquisitions, disposition of surplus space through subleasing, sale renewals, early lease termination, and more.

What you’ll do


Implement real estate plans with an understanding of the client's strategic real estate goals. Assist with project initiation and scope definition, prioritization of assignments, and adherence to the client's priorities, commitments, and achievements.
Concurrently acts as landlord/seller agent and tenant/buyer agent and optimally communicate the business terms and conditions for a wide variety of commercial real estate products, including land, office, retail and industrial.
Coordinate field broker selection and other required resources, subject matter authorities, and business partners. Facilitate client review and approval of proposed team resources for the purpose of transaction execution.
Draft and build a large variety of analyses and relevant documents, including but not limited to: project initiation, market comparable reports, Requests for Proposals (RFPs), proposal comparison packages, letters of intent, and broker's opinions of value.
Coordinate the negotiation of sales through a field broker. Negotiate leases and lease amendments. Monitors lease expirations. Negotiate lease renewals, locate and acquire new properties to meet client's requirements, and dispose of surplus properties.
Understand how to review, analyze, and interpret financial analysis templates including book and cash flow projections, net present value, and/or internal rate of return financial analyses to enable clients to make more informed decisions.
Work closely with CBRE and/or client's Lease Administration, Project Management, Facility Management, and Finance/Accounting teams to ensure integration between the service lines.
Closely lead all transaction activity (commissionable and non-commissionable), prepare commission forecasts and vouchers, and accounts for all savings results achieved on behalf of clients.
Monitor and maintain a real estate project tracking system to ensure timely transaction completion. Prepare reports and make presentations to relevant parties.
Adhere to all state real estate agency requirements. Ensure compliance with CBRE's corporate policies as they relate to identifying and mitigating potential issues.
Resolve landlord and tenant disputes.
Other duties may be assigned.
What you’ll need


Bachelor's degree in business or related field, MBA preferred.
5+ years of commercial real estate transactions experience or similar combination of industry tenure and education.
Real Estate Salesperson license.
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation ability.
Superior analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to problem solve and develop multiple solutions.
Advanced computer proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.
Experience conducting financial and business analysis, preparing budgets, forecasts and reports.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to handle several projects simultaneously.
Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers.
Business acuity, leadership, and strong negotiation skills.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future.

Determined. Imaginative. Curious. If these are some of the ways you describe yourself — we want to learn more about you! At TC Energy, we are Energy Problem Solvers — passionate about transitioning North America to cleaner energy while meeting the energy demands of today and tomorrow. If that sounds like a challenge you want to help tackle, we want you to join our team!
Posting Close Date: December 5, 2023
Relocation Eligibility: This position is eligible for our domestic relocation program
To remain competitive, support our high-performance culture and allow for more flexibility in the way we work, we offer a hybrid work model and flexible dress code for our eligible office-based workforce in Canada, the U.S. and Mexico.
You’ll be set up for success, backed by TC Energy’s highly reputable customer standing and a solid financial base. Our mission is to give customers flexibility and enhanced services, while building additional value for TC Energy in managing risks and opportunities in the marketplace. Here’s your chance to do that.
The opportunity
Our Power and Gas Trading Team is growing to meet our strategic needs and help drive solutions offered to our customers. We are expanding our presence in Houston, Texas, through TC Energy Marketing, a non-regulated affiliate Power, Gas and Emissions marketing and trading business, adding to our high-performance team to help us grow, manage risk, and optimize the portfolio.
We are seeking a versatile and dynamic Lead Power and Gas Commercial Operations Analyst who is responsible for understanding and coordinating various operations and settlements functions. This position will ensure timely and accurate settlement of all physical and financial transactions related to Power & Gas, including Renewable Energy Credits (REC) and Broker settlements.
What you’ll do
Reconcile counterparty commodity invoices with TC’s Energy Trade Management System (ETRM)
Work closely with and support the commercial team throughout the deal lifecycle
Assist in establishing and running routine processes for daily and monthly P&L reporting and variance analysis
Validate accurate daily deal entry within TC’s systems
Generate customer invoices in accordance with contractual terms
Contact counterparties to timely resolve billing discrepancies
Work closely with internal groups including Trading, Accounting, Credit, Origination, Compliance, Tax, Risk, Contracts etc., as needed to support the business
Coordinate activities related to owned and contracted generation with the local Independent System Operator or RTO while providing data analysis and reporting to support internal and external requirements as they relate to Generation, Load, ISO settlements or long-term power contracts
Validation and reconciliation of energy and non-energy activity for each ISO region in which we are a market participant
Address new requests: understand the core question being asked, capture needed data, build models, validate assumptions, perform analyses
The ability to understand the trade capture/modeling of complex non-standard transactions
Identify areas of improvement for the desk related to daily and monthly processes
Develop and maintain an advanced level of knowledge and understanding of the competitive energy markets, including Fuels and Power


Minimum qualifications
Undergraduate degree required in Accounting, Finance, Business, Engineering, or related discipline
5+ Years prior industry experience, including any relevant industry or professional Internships
Proficiency in Microsoft Office with advanced Excel skills (Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, complex IF statements)
Experience with physical/financial power settlements or with physical/financial gas settlements (exposure to both would be an asset)
Natural problem solver who welcomes and promotes change
Motivated, self-directed and results driven approach to work. Takes ownership of assigned tasks
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strong ability to work closely with peers in a teamwork environment


Preferred qualifications
Demonstrated in depth knowledge of the wholesale electricity markets, wholesale fuels markets and the associated infrastructure supporting those trading marketplaces
Exposure to ETRM (e.g., Endur, Allegro, Right Angle, etc.)
Experience supporting external reporting requirements (FERC, EIA, CARB, DOE)
Knowledge of North American RTO/ISO market constructs, rules and operations
Experience with analyzing and attributing P&L
Experience interfacing with traders, mid-office accounting, back-office operations to develop efficient communications and capture all relevant data for valuation, exposure tracking and reporting
Experience with Power or Gas Scheduling
Experience with SQL, VBA, Python

TC Energy is a leading energy infrastructure company in North America. We have three complementary businesses of natural gas pipelines, liquids (oil) pipelines, and power generation. Our operations span three countries, seven Canadian provinces, and 34 U.S. states.

Job Description


We are looking for a leader to guide the day-to-day operation of our applications. This role owns the managed services, quality and technical support functions for the tools, while partnering with their peers to bring new capabilities to market. The role is responsible for ensuring that customers can perform all expected functions (such as design, price, transact check status). It is the primary interface between the Shelter Solutions business and the technical (IT) teams, managing day-to-day activities of software development operations, managing ongoing execution and change management.

Collaborating with our partners in estimating, engineering, customer service, marketing, sales, and information technology, you will take complex business requirements and transform them into intuitive customer solutions. You will use your skills to direct how products/features get implemented and, most importantly, ensure consistent delivery, operational performance, and adoption of these solutions.

You will partner cross-functionally to ensure our customer technology meets overall organization goals. At the same time, you will stay abreast of internal developments throughout the organization’s business processes and technology architecture to avoid changes which would negatively impact our customers, instead driving the business to increase operational efficiency and online customer satisfaction.

The role requires a driven, strategic, and tactical mindset; a highly motivated and accountable leader to deliver outstanding services that achieve enterprise KPIs, including new capabilities and solutions. You excel at building relationships with internal stakeholders whose input and buy-in you need to accomplish your objectives. Finally, you’re highly data-driven and analytical, and you always have the facts to back up your recommendations.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Oversees day-to-day operations of Shelter Solutions customer-facing portals and e-commerce websites, ensuring customers can create perform all expected tasks (design, quote, price, order, check order status, etc.)
Lead team of e-commerce operations and QA/QC experts
Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction by ensuring prompt resolution of order-related issues while working with the team to address the backlog of tickets, prioritizing, planning and coordinating maintenance releases coordinating with other environments (i.e., ERP, CRM) to avoid conflicts.
Monitor key performance indicators to ensure systems are operating properly while supporting sales and customer retention goals.
Partner with the product owners and business groups (customer service, sales, credit, pricing, marketing, legal, tax) to define detailed requirements and translate into technical requirements for developers.
Lead project sprint planning efforts with your team and others as needed to set clear and realistic timelines for your work.
Reviews third party development estimates for accuracy, providing clarifications as needed
Manages workload of third party resources balancing estimates against priority and budget
Overseeing requirements implementation in design, configuration, and software development
Coordinates efforts across internal and 3rd party resources to complete work on time and in scope
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure integrations with backend systems function properly while ensuring data quality and security
Partners with customer technical support team to identify and resolve issues promptly while keeping them team informed of new features / changes to systems they support
Owns the quality management (QA/QC) and testing process to ensure product designs and functionality are implemented to specifications
Communicates release schedule, ensuring internal users and customers are aware of changes
Reviews all new project requirements to understand operations support needs and ensure support plans are in place for operations, customer support and testing
Provides ongoing training and support for team members


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in business, supply chain, computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience
3-5 years’ experience in web development, e-commerce, business analysis, engineering or project management
Expert in project management (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum) tools and methodologies in software development (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence)
Proficient with data analysis and related tools (Power BI, Python, Excel, SQL)
Strong communications skills in both written and verbal domains
Strong analytical thinking and strategic planning skills with demonstrated ability of turning data insights into product improvements and new experiences
Ability to simplify complex ideas so they can be effectively communicated cross-functionally
Capable of establishing and fostering partnerships with stakeholders in a highly cross-functional, matrixed organization
Demonstrated ability to deliver results against goals while managing multiple products, and shifting priorities through effective planning, prioritization, delegation and coordination across teams and vendors
Ability to build strong and sustainable working relationships with your team and across the org
Knowledge of common web development languages (HTML, Java, Javascript, ASP.NET) and software development methodologies
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and remaining detail-oriented while not losing sight of big picture goals
Agile / project management certifications a plus
Experienced with cloud-based solution architecture and operations (Azure, AWS, Google) preferred
Experience with industry leading ERP platforms (Oracle, SAP) preferred
Knowledge of the construction industry a plus

Additional Information


This position has a virtual-first hybrid work arrangement with a preferred location in Houston, TX with a minimum of two days a week in the office or co-located with other team members.

Job Description Summary
The Project & Finance Analyst/Manager will be the key leader and liaison between the business and IT by providing production support and implementing business process improvement through process definition, configuration of and enhancements in the company's core ERP: Oracle R12 E-business Suite application’s finance and project accounting modules. The candidate will implement, analyze, develop, maintain and modify Project Accounting, Project Costing, GL, AR, AP, Fixed Asset, Cash Management and project manufacturing solutions. This is a unique opportunity as we are beginning to build a robust ERP system, a core repairs' management system as well as a new business Intelligence platform. This role will be crucial to support business functions. It will require working closely with cross functional team members to understand and shape the overall business system landscape

Job Description
Be the ERP Workstream lead for: Oracle Project Accounting, Project Costing, GL, AR, AP, Fixed Asset, Cash Management and Project Manufacturing
Work with business functions to gather requirements to document functional specifications and process flows
Work with internal Supply Chain & finance partners to understand and review the feasibility of business requirements
Gather business requirements for enhancements, customizations and develop technical requirement documents
Consult ERP DT Leader on ERP “best practices” process implementation and drive end-to-end process implementation or improvements initiatives (design, test & deploy).
Responsible for gap analysis of functional flows, provide solution design, perform demo for the Gaps solution from standard solution sets as well customized solutions.
Learn & Develop proficiency with the supply chain modules of Oracle E-business Suite and other tools used with ERP
Provide L1 and L2 end user support from root cause analysis through resolution with both onsite and offshore support resources
Promote user adoption by facilitating user acceptance testing and training
Responsible for proactive action regarding updates, including researching known issues, testing key processes, and educating business SMEs/BPOs on existing or new ERP functionality
Work with management and business users to identify report gaps, design report specifications, and test developed reports
Identify opportunities for improvements and enhancements to maximize the use of Oracle throughout the organization
Plan, create, and execute detailed task list based on high-level goals and objectives
Participate in providing solutions for daily production issues or for any other maintenance activities which might also involve change management process
Test and document code updates. This includes unit testing, component integration testing, system integration testing, performance testing, capacity testing and quality reviews

Job Description:About the Role

Reporting to the VP, Research and Analysis, the Senior Research Analyst II you will develop relevant experience and knowledge so that they can eventually become an expert of a particular chemical product chain. Analysts will have a client-facing role, not only in answering client queries to participate in client webinars, make presentations, be responsible for some content in bespoke client projects and discuss chemical chains. As such, they play an integral role in every aspect of the relationship with client companies. This can occasionally include resolving service accessibility issues, product support, and data requests.

You Will:

Market products and services through direct and indirect client contact
Perform presentations for clients: online, in our offices and at client sites
Contribute to individual client projects in the ammonia-urea space
World Analysis Responsibilities: supply-demand, long-term pricing, trade and a written description of the current and forecast state of the industry

Econometrics - Maintenance and modifications for product specific models

Maintain product capacities based on market intelligence
Pursue and develop unique analytical approaches that provide value to clients and potential clients

You Have:

Bachelor's Degree - Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Economics/Business
Demonstrable related work experience
Previous work experience in a Petrochemicals company a significant advantage
Previous experience using analytical skills, as a Business Analyst
Experience in customer-facing roles an advantage
Chemical industry knowledge combined with a good level of product expertise
Expertise with Microsoft Office products, particularly MS excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets)
A conceptual understanding of how economics and politics influence markets
Capable public speaker

JAS is an international, non-asset-based supply chain services and solutions company. Our services include air and ocean freight forwarding, contract logistics, customs brokerage, distribution, inbound logistics, truckload brokerage and other supply chain management services, including consulting, the coordination of purchase orders and customized management services.
As the Project Manager you are responsible for managing the successful delivery and implementation of global projects to all JAS Subsidiaries. The position manages and supports all activities required for a successful implementation ensuring adherence to timeframes and schedules as established by JAS Management and the Project Team members. The position is responsible for identifying issues and resolution, maintaining project databases, issuing project reports and status updates.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Ensure that projects execute in accordance with the JAS IT Project Lifecycle process.
Consults with management and project team leads/members to determine implementation scope.
Produce comprehensive project schedules that ensure that projects deliver the agreed scope.
Co-ordinate resource allocation to projects in a matrix management structure.
Responsible for providing time status updates to Management and all project stakeholders.
Work with the project teams to identify and resolve risks and issues that jeopardize project delivery.
Manage project team resources to ensure tasks are kept on track and completed in the required timelines.
Conduct, document and publish minutes for regular project team meetings to ensure the teams are focused and on track with activities and schedules.
Use each and every project assigned, to his or her responsibility to build a culture of efficient and effective Project Management within the JAS organization throughout all business areas.
Assist in developing project management skills and techniques within additional staff.
Develop a Project Costing mechanism to assign costs to internal resources (staff and other) to produce realistic budgets and costs for projects.
Works with other JAS personnel to cross train and transfer knowledge.
Maintain effective communication across all areas of JAS Worldwide.
Assist in designing technical solutions, based on functional business requirements.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
This job may or may not have Supervisory responsibilities.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Excellent organizational skills.
Excellent written and verbal skills to include writing routine reports and correspondence.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office suite.
Detail oriented, able to multitask and meet deadlines.
Self-motivated, able to work in a team and independently.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization.
Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divides in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Excellent technology skills, including the use of project management, database management, presentation and word processing software.
General understanding of Freight Forwarding and Logistics Industry is a plus.
High energy level
Comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with day-to-day activities
Sound judgment and the ability to work under time pressures.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
College degree in Business Management, Computer Science/MIS or equivalent of education.
Successfully managed scope for multiple projects.
Responsible for determining scope management section of the project schedule.
Manage project quality.
Should have 3+ years’ experience in a business analysis role.
Should have 3-5+ years experience in Project Management.
Logistics and supply chain experience preferred.
ENVIRONMENT:
100% performed in climate-controlled internal office environment working under normal office conditions. Travel will be (up to 10%) required in support of the position’s responsibilities.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; walk; use hands and finger to feel and handle; reach with arms and hands; talk and hear. While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stoop, kneel, and crouch; lift weight or exert a force up to a maximum of 25 pounds.
ADDITIONAL:
The responsibilities associated with this job will change from time to time in accordance with the Company’s business needs. More specifically, the incumbent may be required to perform additional and/or different responsibilities from those set forth above.
The above declarations are not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job described, nor are they intended to be such a listing of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Rather, they are intended only to describe the general nature of the job.

Job Title: SharePoint Developer (Business Analyst) (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)
Job Description:
Title:

SharePoint Developer (Business Analyst) (Supporting NASA at Johnson Space Center)

BELONG. CONNECT. GROW. with KBR.

Around here, we define the future. We are a company of innovators, thinkers, creators, explorers, volunteers, and dreamers. But we all share one goal: to improve the world responsibly and safely.

The Human Health & Performance IT (HHPIT) SharePoint Developer Business Partner hybrid role is intended to provide technical application solutions to meet customer needs by configuring SharePoint sites using built-in SharePoint functionality and custom SharePoint solution development (client-side) and to provide customer interface support. The selected individual will provide support for the design, development, testing and implementation of medical data information systems and/or interfaces for various users, including the JSC clinics, Space Medicine staff, and mission medical support teams as well as other business units. The general purpose of these systems is to support the accumulation, storage, display, analysis and exchange of human subject health related data between various groups. SharePoint configuration activities will be performed using SharePoint 2016 and SharePoint Online. This role will also be responsible for gathering Business requirements, assisting in Integration and Acceptance Testing, supporting the development of training and implementation material, participating in the implementation, and providing post-implementation support. In addition, this role requires someone who will aggressively extract requirements from stakeholders while developing and maintaining productive working relationships both during and after project completion.

This position will support the Human Health Performance Contract and will be located at NASA Johnson Space Center, 2101 E NASA Pkwy, Houston, TX 77058.


Responsible for compliance with Safety, Health and Environmental plan; must be committed to a high standard of safety and be willing and able to comply with all safety laws and all of the Company’s safety policies and rules and must be willing to report safety violations and potential safety violations to appropriate supervisory or management personnel.
Responsible for compliance with the Quality Assurance Plan, policies and procedures
Responsible for completing all assigned training
Know, and adhere to, KBR policies, procedures and work rules, and demonstrate a strong work ethic.
Maintain confidentiality of all financial, contractual, medical and personal information to which access has been granted.
Participate in all areas of the definition, design, development, testing, implementation, training and support of the contract collaboration SharePoint portal, various SharePoint-related KBR application development projects, using an integrated software development process based on industry best practices.
Support the technical goals of the HHPIT Application Development Team by working closely with the HHPIT Team Lead in all application design and development phases.
Support the adoption, implementation and constant continual improvement of accepted processes for software development, code migration and configuration control.
Participate in design and planning meetings to support the technical infrastructure needs of various projects.
Gather and document functional requirements from user representatives.
Develop workflow, data flow, and business process diagrams. Use these diagrams to communicate effectively with customers and developers.
Develop documentation of technical design specifications and as-built technical system documentation.
Exercise analytical and problem-solving skills, in defining requirements for effective solutions to customer needs.
Communicate and negotiate effectively with customers and technical staff, and in balancing demands with practical capabilities.
In cooperation with the HHPIT Team Lead and other HHPIT developers, design all layers of proposed applications/sites, including user interface, middle-tier and database (as applicable).
Configure SharePoint to support the requirements and design for all layers of proposed applications/sites.
Conduct appropriate unit testing and system/integration testing of all developed applications/sites.
Review, add and update content on SharePoint (libraries, Lists, views, etc.) and Websites
Assist in the development and delivery of user and/or technical support staff training on developed applications/sites.
Prepare and deliver high-quality presentations as needed
Work closely with customers and other Information Architecture staff to define requirements for IT systems
Coordinate and participate in definition and planning meetings to support the functional needs of various projects
Assist in appropriate testing of all purchased or developed applications and interfaces
Assist with the proper coordination and conduct of user acceptance testing of all developed applications and SharePoint sites.
Provide weekly status reports of work activities to the Application Development Team Lead(s).
Create documentation to support all of the above, as well as additional items as necessary.
Develop, execute, and adhere to project plans and project schedules for all work as approved by the Application Development Lead(s)
Balance academic software development principles and customer requests with practical constraints to meet project deadlines
Work with users and technical support staff to coordinate and execute proper migration of developed applications/sites into a production environment.
Utilize Microsoft Azure Devops Server as both a Code Repository and Application Lifecycle Management tool as necessary.
Ensure compliance with all applicable KBR and NASA standards and work instructions.
Establish, promote and maintain a service-oriented, customer-service focused culture that supports new custom development, COTS and sustaining activities.
Ensure that deliverables meet KBR and NASA quality standards.
Other duties as assigned. Responsibilities occasionally require work on weekends and/or evenings, sometimes with little to no advance notice.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
REQUIRED:
This role requires a Bachelor's degree plus 10 years' work experience with SharePoint, or equivalent experience if no degree with a minimum of 2 years of recent experience as a business analyst. The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing with personnel at all levels, both one on one and in groups, is essential. A proven ability to coordinate with team members, project staff, customers, users, and other stakeholders is required. Candidates must be self-starters who have a proven ability to work independently.

DESIRED:

Experience with object-oriented programming.
Knowledge of, and experience with relational database design/development and analytical database design/development.
Knowledge of, and experience with formal software development project management tools and methods.
Prior NASA experience.
MCSD or other software development related certification.
Experience with software development in a medical environment.
Experience with modeling and diagramming concepts & tools.
Configuration Management experience.

SKILLS/TRAINING
REQUIRED:

Demonstrable experience in the following technologies is required: SharePoint configuration, SQL Server, SQL Server Reporting Services, JavaScript
Willingness to learn SharePoint Online PowerApps
Superior customer-service skills
Excellent communications skills
Great attention to detail
Excellent documentation skills
Ability to think strategically - see the 'big picture' and work towards larger goals
Critical thinking and conceptual modeling skills

DESIRED:
Experience with the following technologies is desirable: SharePoint Online, PowerApps, ShareGate Migration Tool, JavaScript Web Frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Knockout, Vue), SharePoint REST Service, SharePoint Add-ins, Client-Side Rendering, SharePoint Framework, InfoPath, SSIS, Microsoft Analysis Services, Azure Devops Server, jQuery, software development skills including ASP.NET, C#, XML, AJAX, web services, Microsoft Visio, and ModernRequirements4AzureDevops

KBR BENEFITS

KBR offers a wide range of benefits for their employees; we offer medical, prescription, dental, vision, AD&D, disability benefits, retirement 401k, travel benefits, PTO, holidays, flexible work schedules, parental leave, military leave, education assistance, and the list goes on and on! We also support career advancement through professional training and development.

INCLUSION AND DIVERSITY AT KBR

At KBR, we are passionate about our people, sustainability, and our Zero Harm culture.

These inform all that we do and are at the heart of our commitment to and ongoing journey toward being a more inclusive and diverse company. That commitment is central to our team of teams philosophy and fosters an environment of real collaboration across cultures and locations. Our individual differences and perspectives bring enhanced value to our teams and help us develop solutions for the most challenging problems. We understand that by embracing those differences and working together, we are more innovative, more resilient, and safer.

KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Avetta's SaaS platform connects the world's leading organizations with qualified suppliers, contractors, and vendors. We bring unmatched visibility to companies through cloud-based technology and human insights. As a result, we foster sustainable growth for businesses and their supply chains. Our SaaS subscription software is used by 85k+ active customers in over 100 countries.

SUMMARY

The Sales Commissions Analyst will provide support for administering the monthly sales commission process. This includes partnering closely with other department stakeholders and the Sales Operations team to support the processing of monthly sales commissions for a variety of sales commission eligible positions at Avetta. This will include the review, calculation, and approval of allocated commissions for payroll processing to ensure accurate and timely monthly/quarterly commission payments. The Sales Commission Analyst should be detail oriented with strong financial and analytics capabilities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Process monthly/quarterly commissions payouts in Spiff for Payroll processing and payment.
Provide ad-hoc support for internal Sales Operations deliverables, pertaining to Sales Compensation, CRM/Sales data maintenance and/or Sales Reporting.
Demonstrate strong collaboration skills to partner with key cross-functional partners, notably Finance, HR and key Sales stakeholders.
Must demonstrate immaculate attention to detail and advanced data management and analytical skills, strong Excel and other financial software skills.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a technical or business discipline.
5+ years of Finance, Accounting or Sales Compensation experience preferred.
Ability to synthesize and aggregate large amounts of data, and subsequently summarize the data for executive consumption.
Experience with Salesforce and Commissions Software.
Strong Excel for financial analytics.

Job Title: Capgemini Consultant I (Campus Hire)

Job description:

You will learn and develop the knowledge, technical skills, and core consulting behaviors required to succeed at Capgemini. You will learn an appropriate methodology and acquire knowledge of a business domain, a package-based solution, or a technical tool or programming language. You demonstrate flexibility and versatility in meeting objectives and should be able to manage your workload and update management on task progress.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Writing and reviewing code, programming, and software development, fixing bugs, testing and quality assurance, interpreting architecture and design, etc.

Analyzing data provided by the client, creating insights, and providing recommendations that are based on data-driven decision making.

Life at Capgemini

Capgemini supports all aspects of your well-being throughout the changing stages of your life and career. For eligible employees, we offer:

Flexible work
Healthcare including dental, vision, mental health, and well-being programs

Brief role description:

Position provides M&A valuation and execution support for acquisitions and/or mergers that are aligned with the Company's strategic direction. Financial management support extends throughout the M&A lifecycle, including valuation, financial and business case development, synergy and dyssynergy analysis, presentation to business/market leaders and corporate executive team, full financial due diligence, development and consensus building for an actionable integration plan, and overseeing and tracking value capture and performance post-close. Position manages a Senior Analyst/Manager, and closely partners with closely with CFO and numerous internal and external parties across a wide array of functional and business leadership areas.

Primary areas of responsibility:

Manage valuation/return, business case development, and executive/BOD presentations to support company's growth through M&A
Drive consensus building/alignment on business case (including synergies, costs) with numerous internal partners and appropriate business/market leadership team
Perform or manage external financial/accounting due diligence for each transaction assigned. Collaborate closely with all other functional areas of due diligence team (i.e. Commercial, Supply Chain, Sales, Real Estate/Construction, Tax, BT, QA, Legal) in addition to business/market leadership team accountable for a specific transaction
Support development and consensus building for integration plans prior to deal closing
Tracks and manages value capture, financial performance, and execution of the acquisitions post-close
Managing, coaching and professional development of Manager/Senior Analyst direct report

Finance or Accounting degree required
MBA preferred
CPA or CFA a plus

10 years progressive financial management, inclusive of some direct M&A experience (investment banking, corp. finance, or TAS firm environment preferred), Working knowledge of the Industry a plus.

Understanding of how to gather competitive market intelligence and market insights

Ability to assess financial assumptions, potential synergies, and strategic rational to appropriately evaluate deals
Business analysis skills, the ability to see implications and provide consultative solutions/recommendations
Analytical and problem solving skills in fast pace environment
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines
Proficient in Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Results orientated
Ability to document and track project progress
Excellent communication skills

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (Full Time) - Sugar Land or Dallas
Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Will work with the Business Intelligence team focused on providing solutions to complex business problems through the configuration, integration, testing and support of our software applications. This role requires project management experience and a strong technical background. This Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. It requires a blend of analytical skills as well as extensive user interaction and great interpersonal skills.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology
Translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the BI team and manages changes to such specifications
Update, implement and maintain procedures
Perform some User Acceptance Testing
Assist in the definition of project scope and success criteria
Prepares business cases including cost/benefit analysis for proposed processes
Develops reports and documents for existing business processes and business rules
Adheres to IT policies and procedures and industry accepted practice
Conducts post implementation review and document goal attainment

QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Certification: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information systems or equivalent. Project management certification a plus.

Required Knowledge

Experience in business analysis in an Agile environment.
Experience with agile work organizations tools (Azure DevOps, Basecamp).
Have a solid understanding of software development life cycles.
Strong technical background allowing to provide credible leadership to the BI
team and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues.
A solid understanding of how APIs and databases function at a high level.
Experience creating functional requirements and use cases.
Experience implementing technology applications.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills are essential.

Experience Required

7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
3+ years managing and/or leading IT project implementations
3-5 years of experience in financial/banking industry a plus

Skills/Abilities

Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and can establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and other departments/agencies.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Excellent documentation skills.
Must be willing to work after-hours
Must work well in a team environment
Must be able to interface with users and vendors
Must have sense of urgency and ownership to support financial applications, with architectural and system component knowledge preferred
Proficiency in interpersonal communication, presentation, problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with attention to detail and accuracy.
Must be a self-starter that is driven to understand and complete tasks within the guidelines and timeframes assigned.

Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
40 hours per week

Position Overview:

The Vice President, Project Management Office (PMO) will establish a project management office and implement standardized procedures for successful end-to-end project execution. The position will provide leadership, strategic direction, and management of all associated processes and functions across technical and non-technical domains. The position will ensure overall alignment of project and business requirements to ensure that project management is handled consistently across the organization. The position will be responsible for providing updates on project status, tracking, financial implications, and overall performance. The VP, PMO will hire and develop an appropriately sized team of business analysts and project managers, as needed.

Responsibilities may include:

Establish and support ongoing development of PMO to support successful execution of programs and projects
Design and develop PMO guidelines, processes, & procedures on project management to align with QuVa goals
Create and lead a team of high performing project managers and business analysts who partner with stakeholders from initial conception and strategic planning through execution and continuous improvement
Define PMO best practices to create appropriate milestones and track overall project performance
Standardize project management tools, templates, and methodology leveraging industry standards for consistent repeatable quality delivery
Develop effective project and program metrics, KPIs, and reporting including but not limited to resource capacity, utilization, project status, project health, variance, and risk
Own change management planning and execution as required
Build strong relationships with all stakeholders, fostering cooperation, coordination, and communication across the organization
Collaborate with other departments across all sites to execute on timelines to meet strategic goals
Develop and maintain effective escalation and risk management processes
Provide stewardship and leadership for the enterprise portfolio of programs, driving higher return, ensuring architectural fit
Other duties as assigned

Experience
Required
Legally authorized to work in the job posting country
Bachelor’s degree required; MS / MBA preferred
Project Management Certification (PMP) required
Minimum 10 years’ experience in project and program management
Demonstrated experience leading a Project Management Office for a mid-sized organization with experience establishing the department within the organization
Strong business and financial acumen with focus on problem-solving, data analysis, critical thinking, business analysis, and organizational skills
Experience with current best practice project management tools, methodology, and software
High level of emotional intelligence, influencing skills, and communication skills to enable collaboration with a variety of key stakeholders including senior executive stakeholders
Ability to effectively create a collaborative, team-oriented environment including mentoring and motivating team members to be accountable
Strong documentation skills for project deliverables while using established tools, including Master Control, INFOR, Excel, etc.
Preferred
Manufacturing pharmaceutical, or Healthcare industry experience is a plus
Knowledge of current good manufacturing processes (cGMP) is a plus

Company Generac Power Systems

Name Regional Development Manager II

Req # 63650

Employment Type Full Time

Shift 1st

At Generac, we bring our best energy to work every day and promote a drive to win while respecting others and supporting growth. Join us, as we inspire change for a better world, positively impact our people and the community, influence and achieve positive results that support growth, and innovate the industry.
The Regional Development Manager is responsible for sales growth, market expansion, and go to market strategies for assigned regional distribution partners. This role will develop sales and regional distribution strategies along with distributor trainings and marketing communication tactics to ensure execution of programs and market share growth. This position will act as a liaison between assigned regional distribution partners and key customers while working closely with distributor channel leadership, Director of Sales, and internal departments to create business plans for greater market penetration. Coordinate all marketing activities with distribution partners; building, designing, and executing the plans needed to grow share within the markets of responsibility.
Territory Coverage: Texas and Louisiana

Duties and Responsibilities:
Develops, designs, and executes short term and long-term business plans related to all aspects/divisions of regional distribution partners.
Develops and implements strategic relationships with key decision makers.
Conducts sales presentations and provides training on new programs and products.
Works with distributors to increase parts and service sales, leveraging Generac products and services.
Supports all promotional programs and new product launches.
Expands product line within current distribution partners.
Identifies and develops new business opportunities.
Analyzes territory opportunities and discovers customer needs.
Creates KPI’s to align with overall channel goals.
Tracks and reports on territory metrics and regularly coordinates all marketing activities with distribution partners.
Provides reconnaissance of competitors’ influence within territory and develops a plan to counter their influence within assigned territory.
Creates solution-based sales strategies.

Minimal Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
5 years field sales experience in 2 step distribution
Experience in electrical, trade experience, power generation, or installed equipment industries.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with electrical and HVAC wholesale partners, electrical contractors, HVAC contractors, from a partnership and business development standpoint.
Territory marketing campaign development, conduct, present and provide training on products & programs
Proficiency with business analysis to understand key business metrics.
Previous experience using SAP or equivalent ERP.

Knowledge/ Skills:
Effective negotiation skills with the ability to understand the complex sales process.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills across multiple audiences including top management.
Effective presentation skills.
Self- motivated with the ability to work independently in a field-based role.
Ability to define complex problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Visit multiple locations daily.
Proven ability to implement process improvements within a matrix organization.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite.
Physical demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job include are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Ability to travel overnight at least 50%.

Job Title: Senior Associate, BTS Technical Business Analyst
Job Description:
At KPMG, you can become an integral part of a dynamic team at one of the world's top tax firms. Enjoy a collaborative, future-forward culture that empowers your success. Work with KPMG's extensive network of specialists & enjoy access to our Ignition Centers, where deep industry knowledge merges with cutting-edge technologies to create innovative tax solutions. Join a diverse team helping high-profile clients understand, analyze, and respond to complex business opportunities and challenges. Develop your career through a range of multifaceted engagements, formal training, and informal mentoring. At KPMG, we believe nothing is more important than investing in our culture because it's an investment in our people, our future, and what we stand for as a firm

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate to join our Business Tax Services practice.

Responsibilities:

Prioritize work to meet milestones and complete deliverables in a timely manner while adhering to the business requirements throughout the project lifecycle
Prepare documentation, presentations, charts, tables, and diagrams and conduct reviews for scope, business justification and business requirements including use cases, design documents, prototypes, and business rules
Review test plans and scenarios to help ensure an accurate, effective product and participate in functional and system testing as needed, identifying, and documenting system deficiencies and recommending new methodology
Document and track the status of client inquiries, enhancement requests, change requests and defects
Prepare detailed specifications for developers and apply technical experience in evaluating software modifications that will enhance operating and development activities
May oversee work product, manage deadlines, expectations and often contributing to staffing decisions and supervising the work performed by more junior staff

Qualifications:

Minimum three years of recent hands-on experience using Microsoft Office Suite, UML, flow charting software, change control/defect tracking software, project management methodologies and design tools
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related discipline from an accredited college/university
Skilled in organizing information based on reviewing meeting notes, specifications, interviewing clients, architects, and developers
Understanding of SOA (Service Oriented Architecture), ASP.NET, SQL, XML and Design Patterns
Experience in researching, planning, and recommending software and systems solutions

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - JD Edwards WMS TMS
Job Description:
Summary

The Business Analyst will be chiefly responsible for the day-to-day support of J.D. Edwards 9.2 and third-party systems. This position requires experience in the set-up, testing and support of J.D. Edwards. The Business Analyst provides process, design, and analysis support for developing solutions for interfacing business applications. Drives requirements elicitation process for work efforts of all sizes and complexity. Works in an indirect leadership capacity to influence collaboration, communication, and outcomes of various initiatives. Leads work on all phases of systems analysis up to the enterprise level of the organization's business processes and systems. Provide project and portfolio management for smaller projects and business enhancements. Serves as a key liaison between the line of business (LOB) and the Technology Delivery team.


Essential Functions and Responsibilities

Support the following JDE EnterpriseOne 9.2 modules:
Financials: General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable
Sales Order Processing (Order to Cash)
Purchasing (Procure to Pay)
Inventory
Manufacturing
Warehouse Management
Transportation Management
Third Party Solutions for JDE EnterpriseOne 9.2 modules:
DSi – Mobile Enterprise Platform data collection (MEP)
Define and document business process change.
Assist in the design, documentation, setup testing and maintenance of system processes.
Define testing and training requirements.
Technical Support - Troubleshooting issues or bugs, assisting in resolving issues raised by the business/users, coordinating system testing to meet business requirements and ensuring that new designs and changes to application systems fit best practices and procedures.
Serve as a key liaison between the Technology Delivery team and LOBs.
Collaborate with peer groups in Technology and LOBs to identify, document, and communicate business needs and provide technology solutions.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand business processes and strategies.
Establish project and work request requirements using the document, business processes, and workflow analysis. Ensure all stakeholders are involved in requirements-gathering activities.
Facilitate requirements elicitation sessions and walkthroughs with appropriate stakeholders to plan, elicit, capture, analyze, and validate business, functional, and technical requirements.
Perform current state analysis of existing business systems, applications, and functions.
Prepare user interface diagrams, business process, and workflow diagrams in support of small work requests (enhancements) or large-scale project implementations.
Understand the long-term business objectives and suggest strategies to meet those objectives and introduce technical innovations, as needed.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with business process owners and other stakeholders to develop acceptance criteria and a plan to facilitate user acceptance testing of a solution that meets the business requirements.
Assist/coordinate pre-planning activities (e.g., business case, project estimate, project risk assessment, stakeholder analysis, draft charter).
Facilitate routine meetings with business stakeholders to provide updates on in-flight initiatives.
Attending business unit management meetings, as needed.
Become deeply immersed and knowledgeable about core business functions, processes, and workflows associated with assigned business areas and projects.
Observe and ensure strict adherence to all Technology and Trust policies and standards (e.g. Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Change Management).
Coach and mentor junior-level Business Analysts.
Perform development efforts such as analysis, design, coding/creating, and testing using ETL tools.
Develop code in accordance with acceptance criteria established by the Product Owner
Responsible for development and developing unit testing and supporting integration and functional testing.
Responsible for providing warranty support and providing knowledge transfer to production support.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in finance/accounting, operations, or equivalent experience to include six years of information technology experience with significant experience in software development.
Four years of experience as a business analyst or related role/experience, with experience in one or more of the following areas: Project Management, Business Process Management, Relationship Management, Business Operations, Quality
2+ years of experience supporting JD Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.2 Order to Cash, Procurement, and Inventory required.
2+ years of experience supporting JD Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.2 Manufacturing, specifically Work Order Processing, Kits and Configurator preferred but not required.
2+ years of experience supporting JD Edwards EnterpriseOne 9.2 Warehouse Management and Transportation Management preferred but not required.
2+ years of business analysis experience including functional specifications, setup, testing, and implementation.
Management Experience planning, facilitating, eliciting, documenting, and managing business, functional and technical requirements.
Experience with traditional Waterfall SDLC and/or Agile/Lean methodologies
Ability to interact with management, business staff, ADS, and DTS personnel to gather, compile and exchange information on work requests/project requirements and negotiate disputes effectively.
Strong presentation, verbal, and written skills
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects, activities, and tasks under time constraints.
Ability to effectively interface with staff at all levels and resolve conflicts.
Exceptional communication, teamwork, and influencing skills that foster a collaborative and continuous improvement environment.
Excellent facilitation and organizational skills
Strong critical and analytical thinking and problem-solving skills
Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products.
Understand core systems, applications, and technical platforms.


Work Environment and Physical Demands

The Business Analyst role operates in a professional office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and photocopiers. The employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, feel; talk or hear. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift and/or exert force, up to 10 pounds. The noise level in the work environment is generally quiet to moderate. The visual acuity requirements include close vision.


While performing the duties of this job, the employee is not exposed to weather conditions.


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position; days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm with occasional overtime required.

Travel requirements are not anticipated for this position.

There are no supervisory responsibilities associated with this role.


Equal Employment Opportunity

Qualified applicants are considered for employment, and employees are treated during employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity, or expression, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

Your Job

Koch Engineered Solutions (KES) is seeking a Finance Manager located in Wichita, KS, Tulsa, OK or Houston, TX. This role creates value by improving business outcomes as a strategic member at KES's Equipment, Technology, and Services (ET&S) business unit and by building close relationships with business leaders that allow for healthy challenge processes and economic thinking. The successful candidate will drive cross capability solutions and be a change agent, championing transformation by defining what good looks like and creating clear strategies and roadmaps to close gaps while applying Principle Based Management.

What You Will Do

Deliver sound financial analysis, providing insights into the business performance while driving accountability and profitable action for your area of ownership. This includes but is not limited to monthly financial statement review, forecasting process, trend analysis for opportunity identification, benchmarking, and originating opportunities to eliminate unprofitable activity across the team and business.
Actively engage and develop strong relationships with the business leadership team(s), the controller organization, financial operations, and other stakeholders to better understand, anticipate, and meet business needs
Promote the business team environment by effectively partnering with business leaders and all capabilities within the organization to maximize value creation and enhance decision making. This includes building accurate views of our businesses and product lines that create transparency on where we create value.
Help build economic thinking capability across the business team; coach and apply economic principles and frameworks, as well as develop economic models that improve decision-making

Who You Are (Basic Qualifications)

Progressive professional experience in business analysis, finance, accounting, commercial development, business strategy, or related role
Experience with Microsoft Office Suite or Office 365; that includes Advanced Excel skills (spreadsheet creation/editing, pivot tables, graphs, data manipulation/analysis and formula creation)
This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship

What Will Put You Ahead

Experience with OneStream and/or Infor LN
Experience with data analysis/visualization tools beyond Microsoft Excel (i.e., Power BI, Alteryx, Tableau, SQL, Python, etc.)
Experience in Engineered-to-Order business model

At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate's knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.

Hiring Philosophy

All Koch companies value diversity of thought, perspectives, aptitudes, experiences, and backgrounds. We are Military Ready and Second Chance employers. Learn more about our hiring philosophy here .

Who We Are

Koch Engineered Solutions, part of the Koch Industries family of companies, is a dynamic network of businesses that work together to create an ecosystem of domain expertise. Increasing operational efficiency and safety. Reducing waste and emissions. The manufacturing challenges of today aren't just about improving performance or practicing environmental stewardship, such as managing water and waste, reducing carbon emissions and increasing energy efficiency. They are about doing both, but better. That's where you come in. We are a people company. It's our people who bring the domain expertise and engineered solutions to our customers. Join our ranks and change the world.

At Koch, employees are empowered to do what they do best to make life better. Learn how our business philosophy helps employees unleash their potential while creating value for themselves and the company.

Our Benefits

Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. Equal Opportunities

Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and protected veteran status. Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test. Job Title: Advisory Lead Business Analyst 1 - PDM Senior Consultant
Job Description:
Risk and Financial Advisory - Hybrid Operate

Lead Business Analyst - PDM Senior Consultant

Do you have a drive to be a part of the technology evolution , and a passion for turning challenges and opportunities into long-term competitive advantages? If so, please consider an opportunity with Deloitte under our Project Delivery Talent Model. The Project Delivery Model (PDM) is a talent model tailored to long-term, client service delivery. PDM practitioners are local to project locations, minimizing the need for extensive travel . As a Lead Business Analyst in our Hybrid-Operate business, you'll have the opportunity to gain valuable hands-on experience, share ideas, and collaborate with leading professionals as we engage a diverse set of industries with effective solutions

Work you'll do

As a Lead Business Analyst, you will work on client teams , supporting technology products - including onboarding new client implementations, performing data analytics, and expanding existing business features and functionality to meet client needs. You will be working with other analysts and developers to identify and address technical and non-technical issues. Additional responsibilities m ay include:

Documenting highly complex business processes, data flow and architecture for new systems and data
Creating business cases to provide cost effective solutions.
Following complex data flow to interpret source of information in support of new systems and data.
Recommend ing change s based on business system impact analysis.
Serving as functional lead in technical implementation of agreed upon solutions.
Translating business requirements into test cases
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failures
Preparing and presenting complex written and verbal materials such as reports, findings, and systems training
Building reports using Crystal Reports and SSRS and, ad-hoc queries and dashboards leveraging market leading business intelligence tools
Serving as an escalation point, and guiding less tenured business analysts to troubleshoot and resolve issues
Participat ing in Agile development process and contribut e to sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives
Help develop requirements for, and assist in testing of, software enhancements including providing market and user insights

The desired candidate is a team player who is passionate about learning and working with technology, finance, and alternative investments. The candidate will be detail oriented, possess strong listening, verbal/written communication skills, and able to collaborate well with others.

The Team

We are a growing global team of Analysts and Technology professionals. You will be working directly with team members at all levels, with the focus on enhancement or customization to meet the needs of our clients. Our teams understand the dynamics of serving complex, global clients across multiple industries, and the importance of increasing transparency around business performance. Learn more about our Deloitte Risk & Financial Advisory practice at Deloitte.

Technical Knowledge and Experience :

Required

Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience
5-7 years of relevant experience
Minimum of four years of work experience in IT and data driven projects as a Business Analyst/ Product Manager
Experience working in Agile projects with good understanding of Agile ways of working
Ability to influence peers and leadership stakeholders
Relevant certifications in Agile, Scrum or project management

TechnipFMC is a global leader in the energy industry, specialized in subsea and surface technologies integrated projects, products, and services. Our mission and vision: to enhance the performance and drive real change in the traditional and new energy industry. How we do it: by constantly challenging conventions, tackling some of the most complex technical and engineering challenges and investing in our 20,000+ employees worldwide.

If contributing to breakthrough projects in a truly global playground inspires you, this might be the opportunity for you.

Sr. Enterprise Architecture Principal

Job Description:

Purpose:

Work with the Chief Architect to set the vision and roadmap for the organization's overall enterprise architecture, including for the global applications platforms, including advising on the ERP functional architecture and the enterprise joint roadmap. The strategic-minded Sr Enterprise Architect Principal for Global Solutions will enable enterprise leaders, technical leaders, and process owners to transform and optimize investment decisions and initiatives to balance technical demands, support formulation of business strategy, outcomes, and capabilities. The role helps determine technology roadmaps to support the strategic direction of the business. This person will focus on system design and maintenance of architectures while being efficient, effective, and secure. The Sr Architect Principle works with the enterprise architects, the Chief Architect and the entire Architecture Practice in providing technical solutions and roadmaps for large and complex systems. This person will aid the business in achieving targeted business outcomes related to revenue, cost optimization, risk mitigation and sustainability through the development of business and IT strategy.

Responsibilities:

Assist the Chief Architect and CIO to coordinate and foster an Architecture Review Board, Communities of Practice, and Technical Architecture Committees especially for Global Solutions such as ERP and large complex applications and platforms
Oversee the translation of business and technical requirements and referentials into an enterprise blueprint and comprehensive architectural joint roadmaps that includes the ERP and global applications
Watch over initiatives and their target state for business value, quality and security and ensuring future-state fit
Lead programs to deliver enterprise architecture level services, including governance, strategy, design principles, reference architectures, and technology standards with high-impact, large numbers of users, global spread that are communicated effective to technical and non-technical stakeholders translating needs into solutions that support their goals.
Facilitate innovation – Collect, analyze, review, advise on innovations, trends, disruptions, emerging technologies and opportunities to curate an architectural environment optimal for business outcomes and minimal negative organizational impact
Help leadership determine the strategy, vision of the future and well balanced technology tradeoffs through business outcome-oriented scenarios for long-term Global Solutions and Joint Roadmap planning
Lead technology decision making, standard setting, and evaluation of solutions, systems and technologies to identify opportunities for the organization or improvements, perform due diligence and make recommendations for benefits of the enterprise including standardization, scalability, performance, industrialization, and simplification through partnerships with Center of Excellence teams, technology teams, the business, and
vendor partners.
Provide expert guidance on highly complex projects, solution and architects requiring in-depth knowledge across multiple architectures on best practices for designing, building, and deploying global applications and ERP systems including data management and security considerations
Consult strategically with the organization, senior leadership, IT leaders and with partners on enterprise architecture, outcomes, and results
Identify opportunities or weaknesses of solutions or projects and guide realignment to business requirements
Oversee and arbitrate architecture, platform and portfolio decisions with alignment to principles to meet business outcomes
Accelerate decisions and standards through the approvals of enterprise architecture changes to wisely accommodate business needs.
Provide technical leadership to business leaders
Provide mentoring and guidance in fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement and instill architectural culture of “Think like an architect” to junior architects, solution architects, and technical teams
Set the tone as a senior member of technical staff with the Chief Architect of the EA Values. Doing what’s right, Solving Real Problems, Owning Business Outcomes, Respecting and inspiring others, Innovating with passion

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in a related field of study such as systems engineering, computer science, computer engineering, systems analysis, 1 industry or professional certification
12+ years' experience in at least two disciplines such as technical architecture, application development, database management, infrastructure operations, information security, or business technology or business analysis
Three or more years of solution architecture experience covering both business and technology architecture solutions, including IT products, services and capabilities.
Demonstrated experience with process improvement, workflow, benchmarking, and/or evaluation of business processes
3 or more years of Risk & Control Management experience
Exposure of multiple, diverse technologies, platforms, and processing environments.
Familiarity with information management practices, Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), system life cycle management, services management, LEAN methodologies, operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks.
Experience developing architecture blueprints, referential, standards, governance, strategies, and roadmaps
Experience delivering presentations to senior-level executives and technical audiences
Experience of running large budget categories, good knowledge of the global IT market and innovations
Capabilities to manage virtual teams across the globe
Strong communication and interpersonal skills in a multicultural environment
Fluency in English
Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in the country, without sponsorship.

Work Environment:

Office: Spends a minimum of 95% of the time in an office environment. Rare potential shop exposure if visiting that work environment for short periods of time which requires lifting, walking, stooping, bending, and some climbing. Fast paced atmosphere with multiple priorities and constant change.
Office: The office environment requires sitting, operating a computer, walking and some lifting. Some potential exposure to possible shop hazards when visiting the shop/field environment that includes high noise, heavy machinery, and shop traffic.
